Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel while visiting Venice. Although this was not my favorite hotel stay, it was not that bad either. The positives about this hotel is the location and the breakfast. If you are looking to stay away from the main center of Venice than this is perfect. I would have loved to stay a little closer to the main square but this was not far at all. The hotel breakfast was really good and as a celiac I found many things I could eat including eggs, fruit and meat. The hotel staff were decent but definitly not overly nice. I personally would have been very grateful if they could have helped more with finding a gluten free restaurant. A few times I asked the staff to call a place to see if I could eat there and they really made me feel like I was bothering them. My husband and I both felt as though the staff could have been a lot more helpful and warm. Every hotel we stayed at was very helpful with helping me find places to eat except this one. The bed was also not my favorite at all. Basically it was 2 twin beds pushed together and so you could really feel the slit down the middle. It was not very comfortable but I will say it was very clean. I would personally never stay here again but it really is not bad for a quick stay at a moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “Only minor snags.”
Reviews.Author: stevemof
Reviews.Content: A clean and comfortable hotel with really friendly and helpful staff. The breakfasts are plentiful and well presented and tasty. Situated in a quiet residential area about 100 yds from St Elena Vaporetti stop. About 30 mins stroll from St Marks Square, but far enough out of town to be free of the hustle and bustle and crowds. Tea and coffee resupplied daily by room maid. The snags were only minor. Our bed was two singles stuck together. Some ants in the bathroom. Walls were a bit thin and next door's plumbing could be heard during the night. I would 100% use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Your own quiet corner of Venice”
Reviews.Author: WorldBirderMichigan_
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March of 2012. The hotel is in a very quiet neighborhood called Sant' Elena, about a 15 minute walk along the waterfront from St. Marks square. There is a vaporetto stop on the waterfront only one block from the hotel entrance. We selected this spot as it is quiet and near the waterfront park and the gardens and were happy that it was still easy to walk to the center of Venice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The lobby seemed a bit sparse and not as charming as some of the other hotels we had stayed in but the room was much more spacious and the bathroom was nearly stunning with a golden skylight, all tiled, huge shower, very modern and clean. Every morning the breakfast was excellent with several coffees, teas and juices and an amazing spread of pastries, fruits, eggs, breakfast meats, cereal, toast etc. The breakfast was so good that we often didn't feel the need to eat again until late in the evening like most of the Italians! I would love to stay here again, it exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Space in the City”
Reviews.Author: Smithy23
Reviews.Content: Visited just before Easter for 4 nights. Easy to find though (or even because) it is not right in the centre. Short walk from Sant' Elena vaporretto stop (2mins) and signposted. Enjoyed hotel v. much from helpful staff giving good advice about the city and local food options, to spacious rooms. Breakfast was good with options to suit all tastes. Room was excellent and serviced v. well every day. Enjoyed it being away from Venice centre as the bustle and crowds even in early season I needed a break from! Would recommend hotel with confidence. Enjoyed hearing Italian national anthem every morning from adjacent Naval academy wafting into room too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fudge005_11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. It is about a 15 minute walk from St.Marks square, which is quite a blessing as you can escape the crowds! We had quite a large room for three adults which was spotlessly clean (clean beds every day). The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was buffet style with a choice of hot and cold or both depending on you appetite and was lovely. The vapporetta stop is a short walk from the hotel if you don`t want to walk. My only one negative would be that the bar and restaurant were not open in the day and there were no comfy bar/lounge area for relaxing in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location away from the crowd, something to look forward to after a long day”
Reviews.Author: okanenotatsujin
Reviews.Content: Free wifi Staff are friendly Full American breakfast Quiet suburb away from the crowd after a long day in Venezia. Once got off the water bus, the 2 min walk to the hotel gives a feeling of going back to your home sweet home Come with a bath, rare find in Italy

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at beautiful, quiet and convenient place.”
Reviews.Author: rishparmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights after reading the reviews from tripadvisor and this hotel did stand up to the expectations. Arrival to this hotel is very easy, go to the hotel's website and read "how to reach" section. They have given best possible routes to this hotel. Best way is to reach is to take vaporetto's (water taxi's) from Piazza Roma to Sant' Elena stop which is cheapest and you can see grand canal and San Marco Plaza on the way, which are the main centers of attractions. From the Sant' Elena stop just walk few meters and hotel is right there. It is not visible from the stop as the entrance of the hotel is inside a street. It is located at very quiet and cosy place, green gardens nearby, you can walk upto San Marco Plaza within 15 minutes. There are not many restaurants around this place, so you would need to go to San Marco Plaza for meals or eat at hotel. There are few local restaurants around but close early, around 10. Venice is safe, we used to walk late nights and people were usually there and vaporetto's shut down by 11. Murano/Burano is also closer to Sant' Elena. Hotel staff is very helpful in explaining you where and how to go. Breakfast is really good, lot of variety and cappuccinos should not be missed. Rooms are cosy but small, generally hotel room sizes is entire Italy is smaller than US hotel room sizes. Also there is a 3euro/night city tax that you'll have to pay apart from your reservation. Also HelloVenezia card/pass is very helpful for unlimited transportation for 24/48/72 hours, whatever is your length of stay and can be purchased at lot of places around. It becomes very useful if you get tried through walking, vaporetto is the best way to reach back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet little place”
Reviews.Author: Holyshmokes
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner chose this hotel after reading glowing reviews on trip advisor. The place was very easy to find from the Sant Elena waterbus stop. We arrived at night and was tired and hungry but check in was quick and we had room service sent up to us within ten minutes of ordering. The area: the hotel is in a lovely little area, away from all the tourists and busy packed streets. It was an extremely quiet and peaceful place to be. The only problems we had was that the nearby church bells rang continuously at 8am every morning. The room: the room was lovely but quite a bit smaller than what I expected. I booked a junior suite which cost me an extra Â£90 but in my opinion it wasn't worth the extra money. The rooms were kept spotlessly clean and had all the amenities you needed and these were replenished as and when needed. The double bed was actually two singles pushed together which normally wouldn't bother me but one of the beds was about 3 inches higher than the other and made the middle of the bed very hard and uncomfy to sleep on which meant if we wanted to cuddle we had to both sleep on one side and so therefore may aswel slept in a single! We also found the full hotel far too hot. The weather was lovely during our stay yet the hotel always seemed to have heating on, even the corridors were way too warm. There is air conditioning in the rooms but we still struggled to get a good nights sleep each night as we were uncomfortable with the temperature. There is a decent sized television in the rooms but to us it was completely useless as there were no English channels so we couldn't understand anything anyway. Service: the service at this hotel, in my view, was brilliant. I emailed the staff at the hotel before I arrived to arrange a bunch of flowers as a surprise for my partners birthday and I had several emails back straight away which I thought was really nice (as were the flowers). We also asked the reception staff many times for directions or recommendations on good restaurants etc and they had no problem in marking them out for us on our map. While we were there we also contacted reception for a an iron and ironing board, a corkscrew and a face cloth which were all brought up straight away. All in all we enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate in booking it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round!”
Reviews.Author: IOMManxfella
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice from 12-17th March and chose Hotel Sant Elena after reading other trip advisor reviews on various hotels in Venice. You couldn't ask for a better place to stay. The Hotel is very clean and all the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served from 7-11 which consists of a continental buffet, also very good for choices and tasty too! Although the Hotel is not in the centre of Venice (10 mins walk away), you can hop on the Vaporetto (water bus) which stops 3 mins walk from the Hotel and can take you wherever you need around the city for around â‚¬6.50 one way. The rooms are good too. We had a king size deluxe double overlooking the interior courtyard/garden which was extremely quiet at night so if you like peace and quiet at night this is the place to stay. We would definitely stay here again when we return to visit such a beautiful place that is Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A secluded secret”
Reviews.Author: Michel1962
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from the touristic hassle. But within 10 minutes walk your on Sant Marco square. The hotel is clean and spacious. It has a Vaporetto stop nearby. The breakfast is good, the rooms are very quite. The only negative point is that most of the staff makes a bored impression and is not very friendly, or better not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Stanislav C
Reviews.Content: Lived in this hotel five days. Excellent, quiet location. From the vaporetto stop for 3 minutes. An excellent opportunity to learn Venice on the other side. Take a walk in the morning along the alleys of the gardens Bienali with the locals leading the children to school. No tourists, no noise. In this case, to San Marco 4 stops (10 minutes) on the vaporetto. Overall, very good location - easy access and up to the Lido, and to San Marco and the Giudecca to the area. If you go to Piaca la Roma not through the Grand Canal, and the 6 th or 51 route, the path will take only 30 minutes. The room was very large (about 19 square meters) compared to that offered at the center of Venice. Great mattress, good atmosphere, a spacious bathroom. Free Wi-Fi in the room. Breakfast is worth special mention. A very good choice (though every day one and the same dish) and a good opportunity to recharge in the morning for long walks (after breakfast at 8 am, reminisced about eating 3-4 pm). An excellent hotel network, which supports high quality standards. In the future, when you visit Venice, I'll stop here.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Space From The Crowds”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little way out of the centre of Venice but only a 10min vaparetto ride or 30min walk from the main Square. We stayed during the Carnivale so it was good to be a little way out to get some space and peace from all of the crowds. There are a couple of shops, a restaurant and a bar just round the corner from the hotel but it is mainly as residential area so is very quiet which allows you to relax after a full day of visiting sites and drinks at night. The hotel itself does a nice breakfast with the usual suspects of cereals, scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, cheeses, cold meats, pastries and fruit. So a plentiful selection to start your day with. We stayed on the ground floor in a standard double room which for 5 days was adequate and for the price we paid it was very good value. In general the hotel doesn't excel but neither does it let you down and I think for the price and location it is a safe bet to go for if you like to get away from it all but still not be too far out to cause any issues with getting about. It also proved a good location for getting across to the Lido and also Murano.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: jonandmarkuk
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the hotel, there was lots of choice at breakfast and certainly something for even the most fussy eaters. Sant'Elena is a little bit further out than most hotels but the area is lovely and quiet and walking distance along the lagoon front to St Mark's square or a short ride on the Waterbus being carnival time too we wanted somewhere to escape the crowds. Our junior suite was lovely and comfortable, plenty of room to relax after a long day walking around Venice and ideal if you just want a light bite in your room (couple of supermarkets are nearby one at Garibaldi street and another bigger one on Lido island. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Sant'Elena suited our needs perfectly - a crash pad from which to see Venice. Although somewhat away from the main "must sees" this turned out to be a plus as regards eating as we found the restaurants much better value in this area. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice, good clean bathroom with ample supply of toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are too narrow”
Reviews.Author: Eugenius58
Reviews.Content: Clean and well maintained, the hotel is very well located near a park and not very far from San Marco, about 500 m. The breakfast is more than acceptable. The only weak point is related to the small space of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Toong T
Reviews.Content: Our selected place to rest from our mini-adventure in Italy of 2 weeks across 10 different towns and cities. After experiencing fair share in mid European flair hotels, we wanted something modern, yet with character and quality. Its may seem a little daunting on the map that is is located far from the central attractions initially. But with a short walk from ferry terminal (we got there easily from the central train station) it enabled us to venture into the city daily. One thing to note is that it is the surburbs, so do not depend on eating around the hotel at the evenings, as the only selection is the hotel restaurant and a supermarket around 15-20 mins walk away. (We dined out before returning and grabbed some snacks from the supermarket). Breakfast was something worth waking up for every morning. Food and setting (with outdoor seating in the garden area) is good, especially when the sun is shining. We also went on the free glass factory tour offered at the time on Murano island. Staff and service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and very clean. Beds were extremely comfortable. Bathroom products were top end. Room service excellent. Fresh towels daily and regular bedding changes. Breakfast was varied, freshly prepared of very good quality and there was pleanty of it. Staff were extremely helpful from room service to reception. The bar staff went out of their way and worked extremely hard. The evening meal was good value and well presented. Although the hotel is futher away from the centre, the good value amd quality more than made up for this. Transport links were excellent to the centre and main attractions. We would definitely return to this hotel and highly recommend it to everyone. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to the hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Martin K
Reviews.Content: I recently made a booking for our second stay at the Sant Elena. Stupidly I booked it for the wrong month (January instead of June!). I booked the hotel through a booking site at what was a non-changeable, non-refundable rate so you can imagine my shock when I realised that I had potentially thrown away some $AUD 300 +. The booking site gave me a definitive no change possible repsonse so I called the Hotel to see if they could help. Silvio responded very quickly to say that if the booking site were to contact the hotel they would authorise the change to the booking. Thank you, Silvio and the management of the hotel. The booking is changed so we are now looking forward to our stay in June. You could not have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Home”
Reviews.Author: Bev044
Reviews.Content: Well once again we visited and stayed at the Best Western Sant Elena Hotel in Venice. It was May 2011 a ,little later than we usually visit.When our private launch pulls up in the canal just near our hotel I always feel a sence of relaxation, I feel like I am home believe me I am a long way from our natural home, some 20 hours flying but worth every minute to get there.I researched the history of the hotel some 3 years ago and felt, yes, this is were we will stay.Away from the hustle of StMark's Square,a mere 20 minute walk or I should say a liesure stroll.We have coffee in one of the small streets behind the square,then begin our shopping,eating expedition.Then either we take the ferry back to the Sant Elena stop or we stroll back through the streets just taking in the views and the waterways.It has a calmness about the place that always brings us back to Sant Elena before we begin the reat of our holiday.Life is short so why not enjoy the time.regards Bev.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Vesna M
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Sant' Elena at the end of December and loved it. It is a well priced hotel that has good & discrete facilities and a very good location. This was our first visit to Venice and at first the price seemed to be a bit competitive compared to other hotels in Venice and near by.. However it turned up to be the great choice. . Only downturn is that the sleeping quality (bed was OK but not the most comfy one,) should improve,,, It takes only two stops by vaporetto (public boat transport) or light 20 mins walk brings you to very center and amazing St. Marco plaza. In the same time you are able to enjoy tranquility of every day tucked away life in Sant Elena and if you have time to explore this area a bit more you could bump onto what we think have probably been the best tasted (and priced) dishes during our stay (go to local restaurants where locals go, disregard the looks). Also, make sure you get use of the "vaporetto" at all times as this is probably the cheapest and very efficient way of transport, that will literary take you all around and about Venice. 72 hrs unlimited ticket cost is 33 EUR. That compares to the gondola trip of 30 mins of EUR 60 or even more if you get closer to the city center. All summed up, I would recommend Sant' Elena and hope you will enjoy your stay too...

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here”
Reviews.Author: Kgt12608
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at the Hilton, but our friends wanted to stay closer to the city. I am afraid of "quaint" hotels, I don't sleep well, and I'm very picky. This hotel was wonderful! The taxi driver couldn't get to the entrance because it was blocked by another boat. He called the hotel and someone came out to help us find the entrance. Breakfast was fabulous, the location is perfect. You can take the water taxi or walk to everything. But you are far enough away that you are away from the action. Bathroom was nice, people were great! Internet was tricky on my iPad, but they had a computer

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Excellent return on investment”
Reviews.Author: doug_fernando
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel during the beginning of April 2011 and everything was great. The room was huge for the price (the bathroom really impressed me) and everything looked new with a good tasting decor. I though in the beginning it was far from the "central" area, but I was wrong, I could reach the area even walking and using the water bus was not a problem at all. For sure I am going to stay in this hotel during my next time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Nicava
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2010, it was clean modern and the staff were lovely! the restuarant is also very nice, great wifi and a very short walk to water taxi's i would stay here again if i came back to venice.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars for this Four Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellerGB
Reviews.Content: Our SIXTH trip to this hotel ( 3rd. â€“ 9th. July 2011 ) - even more enjoyable than our previous five consecutive visits to the Hotel Santâ€™Elena â€“ we upgraded to a Junior Suite at very reasonable cost, and enjoyed our 6-night stay even more. Exceptionally good value and service as always. We enjoyed all of the same things we enjoyed during our previous 5 trips - the food is fine and plentiful, the cleanliness is impeccable, the rooms very comfortable and beautifully air conditioned, and, being in the only green area of the island, it's fresh, clean and very peaceful. A former convent, the hotel has a large enclosed lawned garden which is ideal for peaceful relaxation, sunbathing and breakfast. We always appreciate the proximity to the edge of the Venice lagoon - the vaporetto (waterbus) stop is only 200m from the hotel (pity the poor travellers who have to lug their heavy baggage around for an hour or two at the start and end of their holiday in the heat of the mid-day sun to reach their hotel!). The vaporetto runs every ten minutes, and will take you to St. Mark's Square in just 10 minutes (***don't forget to buy your multi-day pass for the vaporetto at the airport on arrival - unlimited walk on / walk off trips***). Or, if you feel like stretching your legs, St. Mark's is only a 20 minute leisurely stroll away along the lagoon edge, passing the Bienniale Gardens and the Arsenale / Maritime Museum (both extremely worthwhile attractions) â€“ a beautiful stroll at sunset. We are seasoned travellers (I'm an artist / photographer) and are quite demanding when it comes to service and value for money. We also believe that good service should be rewarded by recommendation, and a number of our friends have taken our advice and stayed at the Sant'Elena. All have been delighted that the hotel was as good as we said it would be. Great location, great service and very good value. We saw a mosquito there in 2007 â€“ the only bad thing I can say about this hotel. If you go in 2012, we may see you there!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, quite location, but some rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: Mikey90210
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights end of Nov 2011. It is on the south eastern side of the island, therefore takes a while to get to from the airport by the vaparetto, so from Marco airport I recommend getting a boat rather than a coach and vaparetto. We eventually found the hotel as it was think fog, but we were not happy atall. We were given I think it was room 405 on third floor - this room is tiny, and you have to be careful not to headbut the sink when sitting on the loo! I asked the next day to move rooms, which I was able to do, and moved to room 214 which was far better with a double sink and no chance of headbutting it!! I was disaapointed by the coffee cups and glasses never being cleaned though - each day just left and not even emptied or cleaned. Not had that before - oh and for some reason you have to ask for those little milk pots every time you want them - they are never left in the room with the tea and coffee - very strange! Overall the hotel seemed clean (although our first room becuase it was so small had suitcase scuff marks all over the walls), and a couple of the staff were nice and friendly, but not all of them. Breakfast was ok - don't go if just for the 'american breakfast' as the hot side is very disappointing, just mushy scrambled eggs and bacon. But the choice of cereals, fruit, croissants etc was good. Wanted to try the restaurant but on 2 occasions this was fully booked - but looking at the prices (about 20 euros a meal, plus cover charge plus service charge) I would eat out elswhere, as there is a strip of restaurants about 5 mins walk away. In terms of getting around, make sure you buy the vapaetto tickets - we bought the 33 euro 3 day ticket use as much as you like. They are very frequent and we got around using these boats really easily. It is about 25 mins walk from St Marks main square, but it is a nice walk, with plenty of vaparetto stops in between to use. Food in the evenings we found disappointing, as all the menus are the same, and pretty expensive for very little. A tip would be to go to Hard rock cafe in central st Marks Square - we had a good big load of food, at about 17 euros for a main meal, which is pretty good given the prices some of the restaurants were charging! Oh and this place has no cover charge or service charge, which is common in most places to eat in Venice. Think thats all - we had a nice stay with 3 days solid exploring Venice. I would recommend to come here, and stay in Best Western, as we liked the quite location and hotel once we changed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A fairy tale in real world !!!”
Reviews.Author: manu p
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for our annual weekend with the whole family. It was a marvullouse, romantic and very quiet location. The hotelpersonel was extremely nice and friendly. The rooms were very modern. The restaurant and the bar earn a special mentioning !!!

Reviews.Title: “Venice, Italy in October, 2011. Away from the crowd gem.”
Reviews.Author: MatureTravelers92104
Reviews.Content: Decided on this neighborhood location away from the city center, adjacent to a local park and close to a vaporetto stop which allowed us to walk through the park to the hotel. October in Venice allowed an upgrade to a mini suite with king bed, large bath with amenities and sitting area. Spacious for European standards. Good air conditioning that kept temp at exact setting. Buffet breakfast served in a bright, airy room which included traditional breakfast items for Americans and Europeans, meats, cheeses, eggs, bacon, sausage, cereals, several breads, juices, coffee, cappuccino, milk, fruits, pastries, etc. Servers maintained the line until well after the stated time. We tried the local restaurant around the corner -- fair food for fair prices from the neighborhood. Gelato from local vendor on our walk to St. Mark's was half price. Travel tip for cruise travelers - Bus from Marco Polo Airport drops off at the last bus station which is adjacent to a Tram (1 Euro) to the cruise terminals with includes free shuttle bus to ships.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MariannePG
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 days in this historical building. Nice and modern rooms, nice breakfast. 20 minutes walk from San Marcos Square.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Quiet District”
Reviews.Author: altafearn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a converted convent down a small side street. It is close to the waterbuses (about 10 minutes to St Mark's Square) or you could walk it in 20 minutes. The room quality and fittings were good and immaculately cleaned with fresh linen etc daily. The restaurant provides a lovely breakfast with a good range of fruit, cereals, bakery, cooked food and drinks. It is one of the best breakfasts we had in Italy. They do meals in the evening which can get fully booked. They are quite expensive so we ate at the local family owned restaurants which were more authentic and good value (ask at reception for directions). The staff were very pleasant and any queries I had were dealt with very efficiently. My only small concern is that WiFi is only available in public areas and was either very slow or droped out during our three day stay. In compensation however, there are two desktop PCs in the reception area which worked very well. Overall, a great stay in a residential part of Venice away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast and wonderful location!!!”
Reviews.Author: supertaster74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights mid October. Even though, it is located at the far low east corner of Venice, it is worth the vapporeto ride from the train station thru the Grand Canal. The room was nice and clean but quite small since the luggage took most of the free space. It was a double room. Besides that we were pretty much satisfied. Our favorite part was the extensive breakfast served in a beautiful room. The woman at the front desk was very helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions. All in all, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CassieKat306
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with quite high hopes, based upon other reviews on Tripadvisor. Maybe that was my problem, I expected too much. However, when I arrived, the receptionist was rude, uncaring, and got my reservation wrong several times. She argued with me, saying I was too check out a day earlier then what I had booked. I had to show her my printed out reservation, which showed exactly what I booked, until she finally relented, after speaking to her manager. She then went on to quote me a different price, to which I was booked (a much higher price). Again she argued with me, until I showed her my printed reservation which showed how much I had agreed to pay. Once in the room, it was, to say the least, "ok." Every single wall had deep scuff marks on them. Not one, not two, but DOZENS of black scuff marks. The mini bar had dried coffee and god knows what else, all over it. The bathroom had mildew, rust, cracks, and an all around poor condition about it. I tried to connect to the internet, using their hardline (no wifi, for a hotel of this cost?) and couldn't connect. I was told it was "my computer." Funny, I am in another hotel in Zermatt, Switzerland, right now, hooked to their hardline, on the same computer, and I'm not having a problem. Didn't have a problem in Innsbruck or Lucerne either. Yes, I asked to be changed to a different room and was told, "You are single. There are no other rooms available." It was then I realized the attitude and the poor room. Even though I was paying as if two people were in the room. The treatment I received at this hotel, caused me to leave a day early. I cannot say enough, of how rudely the people at this hotel treated me. I would not go back, nor would I recommend anyone to stay there. Two positives to the hotel: The breakfast was great and so is its location. As others have said, its nice to get away from the hustle/bustle of the downtown Venice, to a quiet out of the way area, yet still be within walking distance of the main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover0501
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great trip of Italy and Greece. We were so glad to have an opportunity to stay at the Best Western Hotel Sant' Elena. We had tried to book 3 night with friends at this hotel, but unfortunaly we could only get two nights with them. They kindly recommended another location. As our friends were able to get in for the 3 nights, when we arrived in Venice the Best Western gladly took our main luggage for the first night so we did not have to drag it to Lido, and when we arrived for our 2 nights, the room was set with our luggage already in it. We had a suite. This room was more then I expected for a suite room in Europe. The room had a separate sitting area with couch and tv. The furniture was very modern and the room clean. The room had a lovely with a view of a canal. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast in the morning is also much better then the standard continental breakfast with an assortment of fruits and cheeses, but also eggs and bacon. The location is nice, away from the main tourist spots and in a very quiet neighbourhood, but in 10 to 15 minutes stroll you can be in the common tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Family Holiday in Venice”
Reviews.Author: damelb
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a family trip to Europe where we spent three nights in Venice staying at the Hotel Sant' Elana. We loved our time in Venice and the hotel was a great base for our time there. We booked a large family room which had a Queen sized bed and a fold-out double bed for the kids. The room was beautifully designed with floor to ceiling french doors to a balcony overlooking the hotel's feature garden. The hotel is not central. The walk to the centre of the city takes a good 30 minutes with kids, but it is a beautiful walk and we enjoyed it every morning and afternoon. The location of the hotel also requires a water ferry or water taxi if you're arriving with luggage. We chose to spend the 80 Euros on a water taxi and it was one of the highlights of our stay. The hotel promised to treat the kids like kings, and although the Wii in our room wasn't working and there seemed little other proof of the promise, we spent most of our time exploring Venice and it really didn't impact our stay. The other advantage to staying away from the centre of town is the local restaurants that were often cheaper and more authentic than those in the heart of Venice. The simple pasta dishes we enjoyed at the local bar on our first night were some of the best for our whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lio56
Reviews.Content: Looking for a place to stay in Venice is very difficult, we were looking for a place with NO carpet, and one that is child-friendly. This did the trick. Although filled with stairs, thus a little painful for the lower back, but generally speaking not bad. Very small rooms, unfortuantely the air conditioning was placed where the baby bed would have been, and there is little choice where to place the bed as the apmt is tiny, so she ended up sleeping with us in bed. Generally speaking the architect miscalculated a couple of things when he did the bath calculation - it was hard washing the baby as the glass that prevents the water from flowing out basically prevents adults from going in and out of the shower. We both had to get into the bath and wash the baby while all 3 were inside. It is quiet, and outside of the main 'town' area, which is nice, but makes the ride to the station before last seem endless. Do not take prams if you go to Venice. For your back's sake!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MikeO946
Reviews.Content: Very warm reception from staff and the hotel is situated in an excellent, quiet location - yet only a few minutes away from central Venice either by Vaporetto or by an extremely pleasant walk along the waterfront. The room was extremely clean, service excellent and we particularly enjoyed the garden area for a relaxed breakfast before setting off sightseeing. We would definitely recommend to anyone seeking a quality hotel / base wanting to be far away from the city noise at night, but close enough to reach Venice in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iztok P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two night in the beginning of october 2011, so we got the chance to know this hotel quite good. We were exepecting much better hotel for 4 stars Â  The room we stayed in was quite small, cca 16 m2, and the furniture looked very used. It needs a good refurbishment. The front doors leaked and all the time we felt a breeze in the room (we stayed in groundfloor, looking at the garden). The same goes for windows. Among all the things the breakfast was the most positive thing that happend to us, but if you came late or in a rush hour then you had to wait for the table. Some waited even more then 20 min. The location is good, you had to walk around 10min along the coast to get to San Marco square. Â I would categorise this hotel as maximum of 2-3 stars, breakfast for 3-4 stars. Beat Western has a lot things to do in this hotel.Â

Reviews.Title: “Top knotch”
Reviews.Author: grapplegrommett
Reviews.Content: Great location from which to discover Venice. While it may seem further away from some of the other downtown hotels, it is very quiet, the hotel is well serviced, staff are excellent and it is only 10 min. by vaporetto to all the major sites. Food in the restaurant is great. The lift is extremely small and quite slow but functional nonetheless. Rooms were excellent, very clean and well equippped. Air conditioning good be a little more flexible to be set lower.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: Venice has literally hundreds of hotels and accommodation choices. On my latest visit I think I finally found the perfect location - Sant' Elena. It's only a 25 minute stroll to San Marco's along the Grand Canal and the perfect location if you're visiting Venice for the Biennale as it's only 5 minutes walk from Giardini and 10 minutes from Arsenale. The hotel is set back from the water behind one of Venice's few public parks and because it is located in the predominantly residential quarter it is blissfully quite and relaxing. The Hotel Sant' Elena is a modern, well appointed hotel with a more-than-adequate breakfast included and a charming garden courtyard and top quality alfresco restaurant. As we were visiting for work as well as pleasure (2011 Biennale) we asked for an ironing board which was promtly delivered and remainined in our suite for the duration of our stay - at no charge. There was a minor problem with the booking (we secured the best rate by pre-paying) but this was promptly and professionally dealt with by management - with no arguments or hassles - a refreshing change when travelling in foreign countries. All in all it was the best stay we've ever had in Venice and we'll definitely be making it our hotel of choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sunnyCA21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Feb 2011 for Carnevale. We got a much more reasonable rate than if we'd stayed in the center of Venice and also were able to get away from the crowds of people when we needed to. On sunny days we walked to St. Mark's'; when it was colder, the attractions of Venice were just a few vaporetto stops away. Our room was good sized, with a large couch as well as a queen or king bed. The breakfast was terrific and the hotel has a small bar and serves dinner (although dinner must be booked in advance.) Although we love Italian food, we were thrilled to find a good Chinese restaurant, towards the end of our stay, just a one or two streets off St. Mark's square and to the east. Sorry, don't remember the name.

Reviews.Title: “creative photography”
Reviews.Author: buster30
Reviews.Content: an easy stay with excellent staff. at best this hotel should be classed as the upper end of utility. difficult to appreciate it's creative 4# classification. room size was utility and at times could feel claustraphobic. bed was 2 singles put together with a very definite ridge between them. bar is actually in the dining room and not a comfortable area to sit in. dining is at specific times in the evenings only and closed on sunday following braekfast linen spotless and a very clean hotel. outside is very utility and not very imaginative given we are in venice

Reviews.Title: “Awesome oasis off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Shaunr52
Reviews.Content: Imagine finding a green area in Venice, stay at this hotel and you will have found it. Easily accessible via vaperetto stop Sant Elena and in a good strategic position for you trip to Murano, Burano etc. We were upgraded to a suite and had a beautiful and large room with a great view. We were woken up every morning by the peal of church bells. The room was well appointed and the breakfast was delicious. After a long and enjoyable day battling the crowds around Piazza San Marco, Rialto Bridge etc it was nice to head off to this peaceful idyllic retreat to end our day.

Reviews.Title: “See the more authentic, peaceful side of Venice”
Reviews.Author: austinboomerang
Reviews.Content: The room was great (large, clean, current), the included morning breakfast buffet was well done, and the staff was very nice. Just be sure not to go when the Venice water bus drivers are on strike because lugging the bags to this out-of-the-way hotel is very exhausting. Otherwise, the water bus station is a mere block away from the hotel and quite accessible. [â€¦] We stayed in another part of Venice during another leg of our journey and while it was nice, this Best Western showed us a peaceful, non-tourist-infested area of Venice where we could observe a slice of life moment of the rare Venetian resident. btw, a 24 hour bank of food machines is closeby in the case of munchies at odd hours. It is located along the perimeter of the park that is in between the water bus station and the hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Venice”
Reviews.Author: mango-montreal
Reviews.Content: we arrived in Italy via Venice and we are happy we stayed at this hotel. We needed 2 rooms, one for us and one for our grown up kids and thus required this room with 2 separate beds. Our rooms were next one to the other, in a garden on the first floor. Rooms are modern for Venice. Staff is nice and breakfast is good and generous and is sserved in a very pleasant dining room. The location of this hotel requires that you use the vaporetto as it is one stop after Zaccharia, before Lido. I beleive the cost of vaporetto is 6.50E but bcse we planned on our 2 days stay to use it a lot, we bought the 48h Venice pass for us (on line ) and for the kids we picked up (at the airport) the 4E Rolling card which allows them to purchase a reduced price pass good for 72h and gives reductions for museums etc. For us it was well worth it. To reach the hotel from the airport we took the Aliguna boat for which we had purchased a ticket on line for 13E instead of 15E. (NB you need to transfer to a vaporetto, linea 1, to reach the hotel so you need your pass or ticket, or can purchased at the vaporetto stop)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Italien jewel”
Reviews.Author: kathleen1945
Reviews.Content: Because of great reviews on Tripadvisor, we chose to stay at this hotel for 3 days prior to boarding a HAL cruise. We were so delighted and happily surprised to find it so Venetian and yet extremely up to date. Our (standard) room was spacious and fresh. All white linens, large, shuttered windows that opened for fresh air; large, very clean bath and just all around comfortable. The location was residential, only 20 min. or so walk from St. Mark's Square (San Marco Piazza). Very quiet, just a minute from the Grand Canal and little restaurants within the neighborhood. A buffet breakfast was included and very good. For us, it was just a great location because we didn't want to be in the middle of tourist crowds and we loved the flavor of a neighborhood. It is probably easily accessible by public water taxi (there's a taxi stand just 1/4 block away), but we took private transportation. Which we found to be the Easiest thing ever....when you arrive in the airport, just walk over to the prominent water taxi counter in the airport and ask how to get where you want to go. You pay there and get a ticket. Because we were carrying alot of luggage, the private taxi was best for us and it's also spectacularly scenic. It's also good to know that Venice is absolutely not intimidating. You can walk the whole city, safely, and not get lost because St. Mark's is so visible and everyone understands English.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Away from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: baozao
Reviews.Content: I went here with my partner at the end of June to celebrate my 40th. We were really pleased we had picked this hotel. It is away from the crowds and tourist mayhem of San Marco but only about a 15 minute walk away. Situated in a residential area, next to a park with views across the lagoon. Our room was modern and very clean with tea and coffee facilities and toilettries provided. Breakfast was ample, with plenty to choose from and a garden to sit in if you prefer (limited seating). The staff were always very helpful and courteous and the free wifi in the reception and restaurant (where breakfast is held) is really useful. There was nothing negative about this hotel that I could see and my stay was a good one. Would defiitely recommend it. The only thing is, that it's a 15 minute walk from the main square...we found this to be a plus but for those that like to be in the centre it might be too far out?

Reviews.Title: “Nice out of the way hotel”
Reviews.Author: DogloverSLC
Reviews.Content: I've had good luck with the Best Western hotel brand in Paris so I decided to try one in Venice and I was not disappointed. It was clean and modern but the best part was its location. It's off the beaten path, away from San Marco and the Gran Canal so it's quiet and not as 'touristy'. The nearby park was a nice surprise that I'd like to go back and visit when the weather is warmer. Getting around is easy. Although I prefer walking in Venice, the water bus was approximately a 1-2 minute walk from the hotel which was convenient with luggage. There was no wi-fi in the room but it worked (albeit slow) in the lobby. If you're on business and need reliable internet access, this is not the hotel for you. The breakfast was very good and although I didn't have dinner in the hotel, a couple I met at breakfast said it was great. I'd highly recommend it if you're looking for a clean, quiet hotel with beautiful nearby scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a quite location”
Reviews.Author: rbassoi
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be away from the madness of Venice tourists you should book this hotel but if you want to be in a very good location, close to main attractions (St Marks Square and the Grand Canal) and restaurants this is not your hotel as it's around 30m walking distance. Hotel has good staff, clean rooms and breakfast but nothing special. Pros: Price and Quietness Cons: Distance from main attractions, Queen bed is split in the middle, Surronding not weel iluminate during night, Small elevator (only 2 persons with bags)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient with a great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: egreenway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before a cruise in July. We used the vaporetto to access the Hotel. (it is across the park and down one short block to pull luggage) It is away from St Marks Square and the Grand Canal but is only a twenty minute walk from St Marks or use the vaporetto. Other cruisers complained that their hotels were noisy in Venice but ours was very quiet except that there is an interior courtyard and people will sit out and talk in the early evening (jet lag-beware!) Our room was spacious, up to date and very clean. It included a sitting area, safe and complementary breakfast. We were very satisfied with our choice. Insight tours was there at the same time we were so the restaurant was unavailable for dinner. We ate in Venice at sidewalk cafes so we probably would not have used the hotel's dining room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Skizers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sant'Elena is a delightful place to stay. Our junior suite was roomy and very clean, and extremely quiet, even with the hotel fully booked. The staff were all extremely helpful and quickly responded to any and all requests. And, as others have said, the breakfast is excellent. Be sure to ask for an espresso or cappuccino, which they will make for you at the bar; it's included! The neighborhood is also lovely, with parks and playgrounds and people walking their dogs. It was great to have such a quiet hotel and neighborhood to recover from the hustle and bustle of Saint Mark's.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet delight in Venice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad71
Reviews.Content: Echoing what others have said, our party of 6 had a pleasant stay in this hotel--a quiet escape from the boisterous crowds in the center city. Rooms are good sized and reasonably priced, with a contemporary decor. Breakfast (included in room price) was outstanding, with a wide assortment of breads, meats, yogurts, and fresh fruit and juices. Private water taxi from airport delivers you within a minute's walk from the hotel. Public water taxis are a 3-minute walk away and go to main tourist sites and train station. The quiet neighborhood surrounding the hotel gives you a feeling of everyday life for most Venetians. One drawback is the limited restaurants nearby. The only one within easy walking distance is a good (not great) neighborhood restaurant with reasonable prices. Staff were courteous and professional. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel if you want to get away fromt he busy centre”
Reviews.Author: bec30
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice modern hotel with really spacious rooms. If you want a central hotel this isn't for you but we found that after being in the centre of Venice all day with the rest of all the tourists it was really nice to get away from it all to a really peaceful part of Venice It was very easy to get around, and the stop for the water bus was about a 1 minute walk away from the hotel. It took around 15 minutes by boat to get to St Marks square and if you wanted to walk it would take around half an hour. Really nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPoloGD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a beautiful and quiet part of Venice 100m for a park with grown trees. The hotel is in a restored convent. Breakfast is very nice and it is served inside or in the convent patio. The rooms are very nice. The only drawback is that there is no internet in the rooms. There are two computers in the lobby and also wireless close to the lobby (all free). The connection is not very fast. The neighborhood is mostly made of locals. The park is populated by families, couples with children and old folks enjoying the park. There are three places to eat nearby. Two have sandwiches, very good pizza (a large variety) after 7pm, polenta in several ways, many deserts (all very good), non-alcoholic, beer and wine. Prices are very reasonable and very enjoyable sitting outside with the view of the park and canal. The third is a good small restaurant and it is better to make a reservation because the space is limited. There is also a nearby place to buy bread, pastries, and cold cuts Italian style. The Vaporetto stop is serviced by the lines 1, 41, 42, 51,52,61 and 62. It is convenient to the grand canal, Lido and Murano (Burano), bus and train station. The view of San Marco at sundown from the park is great. San Marco is about a 20 minutes walk away. For Catholics, the church of Santa Elena is a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to take in the real Venice”
Reviews.Author: Flyingkiwisnz
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. Just a short walk into town along the water and beside lovely gardens we wouldn't have had it any other way! Its also close to a water ferry stop so easy to get to around and to the train station. Breakfast was good with lots of selection. Room was nice and clean and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: kuang03
Reviews.Content: The staff was over all great! Very polite and helpful. The waiting staff in the restaurant was great as well! They let us check into our room even though we were two to three hours early. At first upon check in, they had our passport for at least 30 minutes and I was starting to get a little uneasy. Turns out that every person who enters Venice needs to register with the police, so they were doing that for us. At most hotels, they usually take down a credit card as well but at Sant' Elena they did not unless you were going to help yourself to the mini bar. If you plan on eating at the restaurant for dinner, they do not charge you until check out. The food, very fresh and tasty. The breakfast buffet had a great variety of food. Fresh fruits, assorted cereals and yogurts, fresh slices of meat and cheese, hard boiled and scrabbled eggs, and homemade bread. The food was so good I had to at least have 2 servings! The coffee was amazing, it had a good nutty taste that I didn't even need to use any sugar. Dinner was good as well. We ate there twice out of the 4 nights there. portions were decent. Enough food to be full if you plan on having 3 courses. They had a 'flan' on as a starter, which was a creamy cheese and spinach combination. I had that each time we had dinner in the restaurant, and I highly recommend that dish. Usually I just chew and swallow my food, but this I had to savoir. Our room was good, decent size. The bathroom was fairly clean, and the shower was a little small. The walls and ceiling looked like they needed a paint job. The ceiling had some water stains and walls were scratched. The thermostat wasn't too great either. Our room was very warm even when we had the air on. For some reason the lowest it went was 17 degrees Celsius. Having the window open was much cooler. Other than that, the towel, linen, and furniture was clean. There is internet connection in the building but it's very slow so you might as well not even bother. It will drive you nuts. The location was a little out of the way, but it's only a pleasant 20 - 30 minute walk to San Marco. It's away from all the touristy areas, so you definitely won't be bothered by any unnecessary noise when you're trying to sleep. Right in a residential area with a park right in front, so you feel like one of the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a four stars.”
Reviews.Author: ViktorTatran
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a four stars, NOT a four stars Luxe. That mean you can't hope the same service. For exemple, WIFI is free... But only in the main lobby. In your room, you need a laptop and to borrow a cable. At night, no room service. And around, nothing open ! There is at 200 meters a vending machine for chips and coke... But you need small coins and nobody is there to do the change ! The location is okay if you like to be in a calm area. But you 'll have to walk 30 mns to reach the city center. Or to be dependent of public boat transportation. It was my choice and I don't regret it. But that can be borring to be so far and not to be able to do a quick passage to your room in the middle of the day to change yourself or to leave your buys. Rooms are okay, a little bite old and really too expensive for the quality and the service proposed. You need to negociate a better price I got, because 650 euros for 2 nights was definitely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Enough”
Reviews.Author: LaurenBlauvelt
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a very good size and very comfortable..no bells and and whistles, but nice. This hotel is nestled in a Venitian neighborhood...we went to a neighborhood restaurant and a park right on the water..It was very relaxing. We were there as part of a tour and there was one dinner included, and breakfast. The breakfast was fine, normal for what you expect with a tour...The dinner would have been fine, except, hard to believe, as flavoful as the rice was, you could not eat it because it was so undercooked. All in all, I think it was a great value. You could still walk to St. Marks and to all the action, but at the end of the day, you got to experience a quiet Venitian neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK, but Expensive (Junior Suite)”
Reviews.Author: malcolmzx
Reviews.Content: We paid way over $300 for a Junior Suite, so this was quite expensive, even if this is Venice. This is essentially a largish room with the bathroom splitting it to two separate parts, making it convenient when traveling with children/babies who sleep in the bedroom part while parents are still awake in the part with the couch. Our room was in the outside corner of the building; others seem to have other floorplans, according to the fire exit map in the room. We had street views from the windows which are quite high and could not be easily peeked out from. Some of the Junior Suites face the courtyard, which is presumably nicer. There is no street noise, as there are no cars and only few people on the streets in this part of Venice. The room was clean, with nice modern decoratation and furniture, TV also in bedroom. Bathroom was OK, but a bit cramped, with water getting on the floor from the shower. The breakfast was good but not quite at the level of 4-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly run boutique hotel in a quiet part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: FilipeSpain
Reviews.Content: Our requirement for a comfortable hotel with a central location where we could get a good nightÂ´s sleep was more than met by the Premier Hotel SantÂ´ Elena. This is one of the best run hotels we have found in Italy and the cost was reasonable for such a good location. True, it isnÂ´t in the dead centre of town but the vaporetto stop is a minute away and the journey to San Marco took about 10 minutes along a delightful stretch of the lagoon. It is also possible to walk along the waterfront to the centre in less than half an hour. The staff were attentive and helpful, the breakfast buffet was plentiful with both hot and cold options and the opportunity to eat in the garden room meant that we were looking out onto roses and listening to birdsong whilst we ate. The rooms are well appointed with marble bathrooms and comfy beds. Internet access is free and there are pcs and printers available in the lobby for guests. The only downside was that the dining room was fully booked on the night we had planned to eat in due to a large tour group being in residence. Neither does it open on Sunday evenings. Otherwise a most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at this Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: sloshel
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel with no problem thanks to previous Trip Advisor reviews. We were given a room on the top floor of the hotel, and when the bellman opened the door for us, I was totally taken aback...we had reserved a deluxe king, but got a two-story apartment with a private roof deck! There was a living room on the bottom floor, with kitchenette, and upstairs was a large bedroom, large bath, and stairs leading up to a huge rooftop patio. WOW! After flying for about 17 hours to get to Venice, it was a wonderful respite to arrive here. The room was immaculate, and the bed was so comfortable! It is only about a 25 minute walk to the heart of "tourist-Venice" but being away from the chaos was great. There are 2 computers on the lobby level that offer free internet, if you did not bring a computer. Service was professional and desk staff were able to give us directions and answer other basic questions about Venice. We enjoyed eating breakfast overlooking the courtyard garden area. There was a good selection of food and it was tasty and fresh. Highly recommended! Off the beaten path, but the vaporetto stop is just a minute away.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leighlittleton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best that we came across in Italy. We were with a tour group and would reccomend this to anyone visitng at any time. The hotel is modern, the staff is helpful and in a great location away from the crowds of San Marco square. There is a water taxi stop nearby or you can walk to the square. My only complaint (I wondered about a rating of 4 instead of 5) was no wireless connectivity in our room. For business purposes this can present a problem but for our vacation, it worked. Very nice place in a quiet beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet & modern gem located only a short walk from all the excitement.”
Reviews.Author: Thunderaz
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you don't mind a short walk to eat dinner, shop or visit the sites. If walking is not your passion then the waterbus is a great alternative. Whatever method you choose to get in to Venice if you want a peaceful place to stay this is the place. A nice courtyard, with grass, to enjoy a glass of wine prior to your evening in Venice. As you walk to and from the hotel you are in the midst of daily Venice life for the locals. Kids playing in the park, couples both young and old enjoying the serenity and just people coming and going. I would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, comfortable hotel away from the crowds of Venice”
Reviews.Author: lemmits
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite and the room was very large compared to other hotels in Europe. The breakfast was extremely varied in selection and available from 7-11 which was appreciated since we had to check out early. My only complaint and the reason why I would not give and overall score of excellent, is that I could not get wireless connectiviy in my room. The hotel only offered that in the main areas of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely GEM on the other side of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Zlifeisgood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exquisite and modern. We were given a room with a balcony to laze on the chairs. Hotel provided very good selection for breakfast. We enjoyed the dinner on the 1st night at the hotel as we are too tired to walk to St Mark's square. You could walk or take water bus to St Mark Square for sight seeing or shopping. We took two tours to Murano glass factory and Burano colorful island. We definitely recommend travelling to Burano Island as a side excursion for the food and lace design.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the masses of tourist”
Reviews.Author: MissAHB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at SantÂ´ Elene this Easter, and had a great exoerience. The hotel is very close to the vaporetto stop sant elena. Close to the hotel and vaparetto shop is a lovely parc and some food shops and restaurants. The only tourists at Sant Elena stays at this hotel - the rest are locals. It takes about 20 min to walk to San Marco square, and it takes about 10 min with the vaparetto. Some of the staff are really helpfull - experienced sometimes that the women staff at the reception where not so much. The standard room i huge and the bath has a bathtub. Really enjoyed the location - is was very nice to escape from all the tourists who flocks around San Marco square. Highly recommend this hotel and the nearby restaurant (just opposide the vaporetto stop)!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Small room”
Reviews.Author: michaelcb7
Reviews.Content: The Sant Elena is a good hotel away from the centre of Venice but you can walk to St Mark's Square in 20 mins or much less by vaporetto from stop 2 mins walk from the hotel the hotel is clean the breakfast room light and airy the staff friendly and efficient and the quality of the food and choice excellent. There is also a restaurant but we didn't use it. Because of its quiet location you could have the window in the room open and not be disturbed. On the down side we booked a "classic double room" it was very small only room for one bedside table not many surfaces to put stuff down and to access the room safe you had to get in the wardrobe (seriously). We actually requested a King bed you wouldn,t have got one in the room it was clean witha reasonable en-suite. Also the area around the hotel is a bit run down not unsafe but in need of a spruce-up there is very little in the way of facilities just a small cafe/bar /pizzeria which wasn't very good and one little shop we discovered on our last morning. You can easily get to central Venice Vaporetti run every 10 mins or less from early morning to mid-evening then slightly less frequent and an occasional all-night service I can recommend the hotel but with reservations

Reviews.Title: “All-round best place to stay if visiting Venice and surrounding areas”
Reviews.Author: consultantphil
Reviews.Content: Situated behind a peaceful park. 100 metres away from SantElana vaporetto stop. 10-15 minutes to Sam Marco on waterbus. Quiet and tranquil. Light, spacious, airy rooms, comfortable, clean and tidy. Helpful staff. Great choice of breakfast. Easy acess. two lifts-so less queueing. Enjoy the evening in Venice etc then back to peace and quiet in SantElena. Evening bar, evening dinner. I have been to Venice six times at various times of the year, incl.day visits from Lido de Jesolo, and checked out many hotels. That's why when I want to stay IN Venice, I use this hotel. There is no point in wasting time trying to find anything better suited to me. I would stay here even if I was with family and grandchildren also, no question. Some people would try and say that the surroundings could do with being a bit more "upmarket". I couldn't care less. There is a great shop nearby run by a little old lady for grabbing a sandwich, a fruit shop around the corner for a snack apple or what-not, a local pizza cafe, with GREAT pizzas, (drench it in oilice oil!!) and stuff nearby for the children to play on. My wife is NOT easy to please. But she loves the Hotel. 'nuff said???

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico”
Reviews.Author: Elbyem_11
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough positive things about this hotel. It's about a half hour walk for the Piazza San Marco and downtown - some may consider that a negative, but it means it's quiet at night: and the water taxi dock is less than three minutes walk from the front door (along a beautiful small park). This is a residential neighborhood - which meant not a lot of fancy eating places, but all manner of unexpected charms (the morning paper is delivered by baskets on pulleys, up to apartments! As we walked back through the park one night, we overheard someone playing the piano and singing an opera aria!) We had decent breakfasts and, best of all, we were lucky enough to get a "garden" room - make sure you ask for one. They are quieter and more private than the hotel proper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoaoLopes
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, but the staff was not the best. Location was not the beste, but the vaporetto solve that problem

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, Excellent value, amazingly clean area.”
Reviews.Author: Caliguy77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Had a great time in Venice. It was raining and cold, yet walking from this hotel to the main attractions was fun and very romantic, getting lost thru tiny streets and finding our way to San Marc square was great experience. When we were tired we took the water taxi to the Sant' Elena stop and the hotel is about 2 - 3 blocks away. It is located in the Castello district which I would define as the suburb of Venice, this is where the local families live. We saved money by not staying at the heart of the tourist area, and we got a very clean hotel, with great breakfast and a cozy room with excellent views. Not to mentions FREE INTERNET !! I am giving sleep quality 4 points only because it was not a true King, it was two twin/double joined together, which is fine if you had a fight with your spouse, but not so comfortable if you want to cuddle up :) Wife and I would love to go back to Venice, and we are certainly staying there again. The people at reception were nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value just a little out of the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: discouk
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to grab a great value double b and b room for just 65EUR a night and were kindly upgraded to a suite free of charge! We found the staff friendly enough, the room bright, airy and clean and the amenities were just what we needed. Would say that location wise it was a little too far our for my liking, however it is so close to the vaporetto stop and they run every ten minutes so it isn't a problem getting anywhere. Also only a 25 minute walk to Piazza San Marco and the architecture on the way is fab! Great for a quck cheap break!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: CKM28
Reviews.Content: We took a look at trip advisor prior to booking this hotel and were immediately attracted to the many positive reviews this hotel received. But our experience definitely did not match those expectations. We came here with two little children on New Years eve weekend. The first thing we ran into was a very rude receptionist that was extremely condescending and unfriendly. We asked for possible dinner reservations and instead of helping us she riddiculed us and informed us that we would not find anything under $500 euros per head. The room was clean, and spacious. The internet is included in the price but is extremely extremely slow and almost non-existent. The hotel also has breakfast included but the service is horrible, seating is very slow. If you are vegetarian or have special food requirements forget about this place. Although, they specify that they make special arrangements in their restaurant for those people, when we arrived for dinner they had maybe two options for us as vegetarians and the waiter told us they would not deviate from the menu. There is definitely something eerie with the hotel, and I would never set foot in this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Peace & charme”
Reviews.Author: Lola146
Reviews.Content: Good and unique location between the Biennale Giardini and the sandy Lido, the Hotel Sant'Elena, offers a nice, quite and modern environment in a converted monastery building on the Sant'Elena island. The area is quite residential but still well served with shops and "osterie" serving lovely homemade food. The breakfast buffet is really good offering continental breakfast and Italian fine pastries. Great place to stay to recover peacefully after a sightseeing day.

Reviews.Title: “one of the nicest”
Reviews.Author: mikey95
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just got back from our vacation in Venice where we stayed at the hotel Sant' Elena for 4 nights. This is a lovelly hotel situated in a residental area of venice, which is very quiet at night. It is only a couple of minutes walk from vaporetto stop. Or a pleasant walk along the the waterfront from the city centre, about 30 minutes. We found the hotel very clean, the rooms were large with the latest fixtures, and very comfortable beds. They put on a very good buffet breakfast of hot and cold items, with plenty of choice, which was included in the room priceing, and was very reasonable for venice against other hotels. The english speaking staff were always helpfull. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “value for money in q enviroment”
Reviews.Author: Obellius_Firmus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in advance through booking.com and got an excellent rate (Venice is an expensive city). The Best Western was modern, spacious and served a great continental breakfast (buffet), although it can be very busy during breakfasttime. If so, you will be seated within a few minutes. In the meantime you can have a fresh capuccino or espresso. The hotel lies less than 100 meters from the vaporettostop S. Elena in a quiet neighbourhood. It is a 30min walk to St Mark's Square. It is a great location to visit the nearby venues Giardini and Arsenale for The Biennale. Just around the corner in front of the park there is a cafe where they serve the best Italian pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BEAUTIFUL AREA-LOCATION, NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: dremland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 days in hotel santa elena in October 2010. We chose this hotel after searching in several sites and paying attention to tripadvisor's reviews. We booked the room from their site. Generally, we have been satisfied with the hotel facilities. The room and the bathroom were clean and spacious. Both, the quality and variety of breakfast was very good. However, we were dissapointed with the non existence of room service. We arrived at the hotel late at night (10:30 pm) after 12 hours of traveling, and we couldn't have anything to eat because the restaurant was fully booked and was about to close around that time!! The nearby bar was also closed so we had to sleep hungry! The next day, again we had the same problem during lunch time.The restaurant is only open from 7-10:30 pm and you can order from room service only in this certain hours. Therefore, if you choose to stay there, you should always remember to return in your room not hungry!! However, the location of the hotel is excellent as other visitors also say (in a walking distance from piazza san marko, through beautiful parks) and the venice is so beautiful that helps you to forget negative things. Also, we appreciate highly that the hotel's customer care supervisor answered right away to our evaluation remarks and gives promise that they will try to solve the mentioned problems.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money and large rooms - particularly for Venice”
Reviews.Author: tristanr
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in advance through the hotel's website and got an excellent rate. Venice is an expensive city and many of the hotels we looked at were overly floral and decorated. The Best Western was modern, spacious and served a great continental breakfast. We had a little difficulty finding the hotel coming off the vaporetto, however two locals showed us the way. Also the wireless internet, while free and fast, was a pain to access (you required a new login every 30 minutes). It is a 10min vaporetto ride away from St Mark's Square, but there's limited nightlife in Venice and we never felt detached from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: GFL7610
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the easter tip of Venice away from the action. Consequently, it is very quiet but only 10 minutes from St. Mark Square via water bus which seems to come about every 5 to 10 minutes. It is a very nice place to stay, with good size rooms, very clean and it serves a very good brunch breakfast. The water buses will get you where you want to go very quickly. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I Stayed in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Cherrypashka
Reviews.Content: It was my 4th time in Venice and 5th hotel I stayed so far. I would say that it is the best!!! It is a bit away from the centre of the city but it is 1 minute walk from Santâ€™Elena vaporetto stop and a lovely walk or boat ride to/from San Marco. I would also recommend it to explore Lido (when it is completely overbooked during Film Festival, for instance). I liked everything during my stay: quite spacious modern room with great tv, tea&coffee making facilities, comfortable bed, clean linen and nice bathroom. Hotel provides free internet access (although a password should be used) in the lobby and in the rooms as well. Computer in the lobby was connected to the printer which was very useful for on-line check-in. Staff speaks good English and was very respective and helpful. Breakfast was as always good as you can expect it in 4 stars Best Western hotel but with terrific choice of sweets and extremely fresh mozzarella as a great adder. Hotel has a very nice inner yard where you can enjoy breakfast or just the view. And the breakfast place works as a restaurant which is a nice option when you are tired or the weather in not too good to go outside. The last but not the least â€“ is the price â€“ it was very competitive if compared to shabby hotels in the centre. So, I would highly recommend this hotel if you would like to enjoy your stay in amazing Venice!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect option for a few days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: middlefarne
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable, with a contemporary decor and not too much fuss. Decent breakfast, perfect peace and quiet. The hotel itself is excellent, but it is the location that makes the Sant'Elena ideal for a visit of a few days. It is at the edge of the main group of Venetian islands, away from the tourist hustle and bustle in the centre of town. It's a lovely walk to Piazza San Marco or the Arsenale, across canals and along the waterfront. If you're willing to spend the money, you can get there quicker in a vaporetto (they call it a water-bus, but it is certainly a lot more expensive than normal public transport). The location also seems to affect the price - the Sant'Elena is a little cheaper than equivalent hotels closer to central Venice. There is at least one neighbourhood restaurant where you can go for a good, cheap meal (genuinely cheap - not just by Venetian standards). I have very fond memories of my stay in the Sant'Elena.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: SCVoyageur
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews state, this is a wonderful hotel for those who want to get away from the maddening crowds of Venice. Arriving jet-lagged, our room was quiet and comfortable, and we slept like logs. The bed was firm as were the pillows with good quality sheets. This bed and pillow were the most comfortable to me of all our hotels in Italy but my husband found them a little too firm. Both the bedroom & bathroom were large & very clean. The bathroom had double sinks & was well stocked. The room had a mini-frig & coffee/tea service as well as t.v. & central air that didn't make noise. Very peaceful. The breakfast buffets were outstanding! Every morning there were scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, deli meats & cheeses, breads, pastries, fresh fruit salad, yogurt, endless coffee, juice, etc., etc. in an airy, large dining room with a garden dining area. On arrival, we took the no. 1 vaporreto down the Grand Canal, all the way to the hotel. We took no. 51 to the train station when we left. The rest of the time we walked everywhere & enjoyed the views until we got to the tourist crowds near San Marco. The area where the hotel is located felt quite safe in the evening and family friendly. For less able-bodied people, the vaporreto stop is about a block from the hotel through a park. One can buy tickets at the tabbachi stand in the park near the dock. The hotel has free internet once you get a code from the desk & English newspapers. There was a personal safe in our room, which we used. The desk staff was very knowledgeable when asked a specific question. This hotel is an excellent value if one doesn't want to be in the midst of crowds and noise & enjoys walking. Since vaporreti tickets are not cheap at 6.50 E each, a vaporreti pass is necessary for those who don't want to/can't walk the mile into center city. The cost of those might make it less of a value but the BW Sant'Elena was the perfect place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: _Ange_WH
Reviews.Content: Nicely located away from the masses of tourist in a lovely and quiet location. A short walk into Venice via park lands.
