We were in a junior suite which was very comfortable although was disappointed that there was only tea available in the room but no coffee - after our 1st night the milk was not restocked so was unable to have a hot drink in the morning before leaving the room. However the breakfast was excellent and catered for all tastes. The hotel reception was friendly and well kept. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one of the best options in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Luciano_Prado
Reviews.Content: Excellent option if you are looking for peace, silence and comfort. At the same time, it's just a few minutes (by vaporetto) from San Marco square and Lido beach. Located in a quiet neighbourhood full of trees, it offers a must-have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “affordable and quiet area to stay in”
Reviews.Author: mcfliege
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for us because it was a modern Best Western located on the 15th century monastery island of Sant'Elena--very tranquil neighborhood in the fishtail of Venice. There's a very convenient vaporetto stop a hop, skip, and a jump from the hotel's front entrance, which goes over towards San Marco or in the direction of the Lido. This location was ideal because we could walk to San Marco in about 25 minutes or hop on the waterbus/vaporetto to get there, but there were very few tourists. The hotel breakfast was excellent, and there is a big green courtyard to look out onto. The hotel windows could be more private with curtains that fully extend past the windows, but the room and bed were comfortable. The lighting, which functions only with your keycard inserted, kept turning off from time to time for no reason, and the shower has one of those 30% doors, that makes flooding the bathroom floor near impossible--a curtain would be better. The price and location were fine, and we would probably stay here again. Gabriel, at the front desk when we checked in, was very welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Venice!A+”
Reviews.Author: Michael-TCS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Best Western Santâ€™Elena for one night during my vacations across Europe. The hotel was great! I have booked to stay at a junior suite. Room was large with stylish furnitures and a very nice bathroom. Staff was very good and very helpful. Breakfast has all that you want but only the basic. The only think that it might be a negative is that the hotel is a little out of the Venice center. It is about 15 minutes walk to St Marcus square and this might be little hard if you have your luggage with you but do not worry take the vaporeto to Saintâ€™Elena stop and the hotel is a 2 minutes walk. If i visit Venice in the future I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OUR FIFTH CONSECUTIVE YEAR - Five stars for this 4 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellerGB
Reviews.Content: Our fifth trip 1st. â€“ 8th. July 2010 proved to be even more enjoyable than our previous four visits â€“ we upgraded to a Junior Suite at very reasonable cost, and enjoyed our 7-night stay even more. Exceptionally good value. We enjoyed all of the same things we enjoyed during our previous 4 trips - the food is fine and plentiful, the cleanliness is impeccable, the rooms comfortable and air conditioned, and, being in the only green area of the island, itâ€™s fresh and peaceful. A former convent, the hotel has an enclosed lawned garden which is ideal for peaceful relaxation, sunbathing and breakfast. We always appreciate the proximity to the waterside - the vaporetto (waterbus) stop is only 200m from the hotel (pity the poor travellers who have to lug heavy baggage around for an hour or two at the start and end of their holiday in the heat of the mid-day sun!). The vaporetto runs very frequently, and will take you to St. Mark's Square in just 10 minutes (*don't forget to buy your multi-day pass for the vaporetto at the airport on arrival - unlimited walk on / walk off trips). Or, if you feel like stretching your legs, St. Mark's is only a 20 minute leisurely stroll away along the lagoon edge, passing the Bienniale Gardens and the Arsenale / Maritime Museum (both worthwhile attractions). We are seasoned travellers (I am an artist / photographer) and are quite demanding when it comes to service and value for money. We also believe that good service should be rewarded by recommendation, and a number of our friends have taken our advice and stayed at the Sant'Elena. All have been delighted that the hotel was as good as we said it would be. Great location, great service and great value. We saw a mosquito there once â€“ the only bad thing I can say about this hotel. If you go in 2011, we may see you there!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DrewK
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel on our first trip to Venice in June 2010. After a difficult trip to the hotel from the airport (the ACTV was on strike and we had to catch the ATVO to Piazzale Roma, catch a vaporetto and then walk from Rialto Vaporetto Stop through Piazza San Marco to San Zaccaria Vaporetto Stop where we could catch another vaporetto to Sant Elena - the walk alone was about 30 minutes with all our luggage in high temperatures) we were thrilled to arrive in this haven! The hotel is situated in a suburban neighbourhood, but yet only 4 stops on the vaporetto or a beautiful 20 minute walk away from St Mark's. We loved returning to the hotel and surrounding park in between the hustle and bustle of sightseeing in central Venice. It is also conveniently located for access to Murano, Burano and the Lido. We stayed in 2 groundfloor rooms which opened onto the garden. A minor complaint is that the grass was not very well kept in the garden. The rooms were spacious and clean and had modern bathrooms with two wash basins. The breakfast buffet offered a good variety of hot and cold food, but it is a pity that the servers in the restaurant did not smile much. They even told us to get out of the restaurant as it was still closed when we arrived 5 minutes before opening time (7am) on our last morning in Venice! We were catching an early train to Venice and wanted to make sure we did not miss it. It was pleasant to eat lunch/dinner in the surrounding neighbourhood restaurants with local Venetians. Del Pampo, a block away, was especially good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would love to return to it and Venice one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all-rounder!”
Reviews.Author: RubyFalconer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights and couldn't have asked for more. Although it was a little way out of town, it was so close to a number of water taxi routes that this wasn't a problem. We managed to get an upgrade to a superior room which was lovely with a huge bed, sofa and large bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful and there was a great choice at breakfast. The added bonus for us was the gorgous tortoiseshell cat outside the hotel which we smuggled ham for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Angus1953
Reviews.Content: All aspects of this hotel are excellent. Arguably, the location is not ideal. However, it only took me about 20 minutes to stroll into St Mark's Square and I enjoyed the quiet location after the hustle and bustle of Venice. It is very pleasant to round off the evening with a seat on a park bench looking over the lagoon and watching the sun set over Venice. So, I could be persuaded to give it a 5 for location! Also, the vaporetti stop is very close and that gives speedy access to the city centre and other locations. It is quite good coming from the airport because I took the water bus to Lido (cost 25 euro return) and then the vaporettu over to Sant Elena (2 euro single) which was the first stop. Breakfast was particularly nice with a good range of quality food. Fruit salad was excellent! Eat as much as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hideaway in Venice”
Reviews.Author: OrgulloMexicano
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a quiet residential area, but it was very close to the #1 Vaporetto stop and by vaporetto it was not far from Saint Mark's Square. The hotel was clean and quiet and had an excellent dining room and courtyard with a lovely breakfast. There is not much that is directly around the hotel, so it is wise to invest in a vaporetto pass; however, it was a nice, clean, quiet location with helpful staff. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in lovely location”
Reviews.Author: LJC1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in June. It's situated at the end of the lagoon, so walking to St. Mark's Square takes about 30 mins. However the hotel is only about 500 yards from the Vaporetto stop, with a frequent service, and a lovely trip up the canal. The hotel is in a nice residential area, lots of parkland around, but only a few tourist hotels, so nice and quiet. The hotel is clean and comfortable, it doesn't really have a sitting area, just a few chairs off the reception area, so nowhere to sit really if it's wet and you decide to wait untill the rain goes off. The rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with a decent sized bath, although the 2nd. room we booked with a double bed only had a shower, which we hadn't been told about.. The outlook was over the terrace and garden, which was pleasant. We felt the maid service to the rooms should have been better. The toiletries were not replaced when used, the cups from the tea/coffee making facilities were washed in the bathroom sink rather than taken to the kitchen and washed properly, no actual coffee sachets for the tea/coffee making tray, small things like that which were irritating, but not enough to spoil our stay. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful, especially when the day we left there was a Vaporetto strike, the receptionist was most helpful in finding out information for us. We didn't eat in the hotel in the evening, but it seemed to be popular, but breakfast was nice, hot scrambled eggs, bacon, small sausages, as well as lots of fruit, pastries cereals etc., especially nice when eaten in the open air restaurant in the garden, lovely! The hotel has a bar but it doesn't open untill 5p.m. which was o.k. with us as we just wanted a drink on the very pleasant terrace after a long day sightseeing. On the whole we had a lovely stay here and would certainly stay here again and going up and down the canal on the Vaporetto is always a joy no matter how many times we did it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bev044
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 beautiful nights at the Sant Elena,loved all of it,the location-near the vaporetto stop,close to St Marks,lovely green areas to relax in,good coffee shops and a great view if the canal.The staff were very friendly and helpful,we felt very special.The buffett breakfast was more than we anticipated,plenty of good quality food,speciality teas and good service.Our room overlooked the small courtyard above the kitchen,we were on the 2nd floor.The room was just like the brochure said.Beautiful polished floors,marble bathroom,it was heaven.We are planning to go back next year.Just Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: theskipperxxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days in June in Sant Elena. Rooms were comfortable and very clean. The view we had from window was limited (courtyard and 2nd floor) but the large windows opened to allow the evening air in. Bathroom was well appointed and clean and buffet breakfast was tasty and varied, and included a hot selection (eggs, bacon, sausage, etc). Eating in the lovely courtyard and enjoying the late evening there was a bonus. Staff was attentive and very helpful. Location is a good waterbus ride from the train station, but it is in a very lush, green and open part of Venice, which we loved. A gem of a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Unique Venetian Experience”
Reviews.Author: Arkybergy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were pleasantly surprised by this hotel, including its affiliation with the Best Western chain which has a mediocre brand image in the States. Don't let that dissuade you from booking here. The hotel is a charming property located in one of Venice's quiet, yet easily accessible suburban neighborhoods. The room was quite large with a separate sitting area, bedroom and modern bathroom. The air conditioning worked very well and there were two flat screen televisions in the room. The bed was adequate -- the queen consisting like many European beds of two separate mattresses. Breakfast was included as was okay. If you like Italian coffee, don't forget to ask the staff for a latte or cappuccino or you'll end up with the pre-made Sanka. The staff is very accommodating. While the front desk staff is extremely nice and helpful, there is no concierge staff to proactively help in arranging restaurant reservations. We were instructed to call restaurants on our own. We have come to expect hotels to freely offer that service. All in all we would recommend the hotel, especially for those on their second or third trip to Venice who want to relax in a quiet, yet easily accessible refuge.

Reviews.Title: “tucked away in a quiet spot of venice - near enought to walk to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Phil_E_Usfog
Reviews.Content: Very peaceful and well maintained hotel. 15 mins walk to St Marc's Square so near enough to be "in Venice" but away from the huslte and bustle and away also from the tourist trap restaurants/bars.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing and away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: StacyandPat
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 18 year old niece and I stayed at the Hotel Sant' Elena over Easter weekend. We enjoyed the hotel, especially since it was in a peaceful neighborhood just a 10 minute "boat ride" from the hustle and bustle of St Mark's Square. Our room was a triple located facing the inner courtyard. It was surprisingly spacious. (We have stayed in Venice before and were concerned about the size of the room, since many hotel rooms are notoriously small in Venice.) It was perfect for the 3 of us. The staff was friendly and the breakfast in the restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SaratogaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Four star hotel. Large rooms, comfortable beds. Clean and well furnished. Had a great stay. We were at first worried that because of its distance from St. Marks square that would be a problem, but instead it was a big plus. We used the waterbus which docked about a 100 yards from the hotel and came every 15 minutes. Access to all of Venice was easy using the waterbus (get a 48 hour pass). The hotel was in a park like setting well away from the crowd of tourists. The hotel restaurant was very good but pricey. The breakfasts were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Romanic, Quiet retreat from busy St. Marco's crowds”
Reviews.Author: taurenlegend
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Sant Elena by map looks to be on the outskirts of Venice, but was in fact a much needed retreated from the masses of tourists pouring into Venice and crowding around St. Marco's Square. The hotel is set on a quiet street with a beautiful park a few steps away. The water bus stop "Sant Elena" literally drops you off near the front door after a leisure stroll through the park. The hotel offers an excellent buffet of breakfast and a beautiful courtyard where one can relax away from crowds and read in the sunshine. The local cafe/bar was my favorite. Try the Campari and Orange and their pizza was delicious! They also have a coffee cup that actor, Brad Pitt, apparently used at their cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in a peaceful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: rand0mness
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there in mid-May 2010 and paid â‚¬ 131.75 per night for a double standard, which seemed pretty good for comparable hotels at that season. As other reviewers have noted, this hotel is on the far eastern side of Venice, but it is very accessible by vaperetto (waterboat public transportation). St. Mark's Square is about a 10 minute ride away. No matter we lived, we would have had to take vaperettos to see all the sights in Venice anyway, so it didn't make a huge difference to live farther away. Pros: Two sinks in the bathroom (!) Modern and clean Spacious for an European hotel room Free breakfast had the best @#$% bacon I have ever eaten Free Internet Cons: A bit farther away from center of city "Double" bed was actually two twin beds pushed together Room was not as brightly lit as the website photos showed

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and super friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dean49
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a converted convent but has very modern ammenities. Just on the outskirts of Venice but very convenient to the water taxi and right by a park. Staff went way out of their way to help us track lost luggage that airlines lost. Also gave us a complimentary bottle of Prosecco (Italian Sparkling wine) when we told them it was our honeymoon. Can't say enough about how kind everyone there was to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SpartacusAH
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The rooms are beautifull and the surroundings are quiet. I only hope that the next time the service during breakfast good smile a bit more. Best regards,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Stanr66
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant hotel at which to stay while working or sightseeing in Venice and is suited to business travellers, couples or retirees seeking a more relaxing atmosphere. It is located within an easy walk or ferry ride from all the main attractions. The breakfast is very good and the service excellent, the staff were always helpful and very knowledgeable about the local area and events. It may be a little hard to find at night when arriving by ferry but once found never forgotten - cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful, beautiful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DenverTennisPlayer
Reviews.Content: At the lower tip of Venice- in the quiet Sant Elena area- beautiful hotel. Easy to get to by vaporetto- 3 or 4 stop there. Can walk to the square- good restaurants nearby. Large rooms- no cars and few people, so it is a VERY quiet area- after noisy Rome and Florence, we wanted a room to wind down at the end of our trip for several nights. Buffet breakfast is much better than average. Several parks nearby. Area is almost entirely locals. It is not in the heart of the action, but if you want to get away at the end of the night, I would fully recommend this hotel. The water taxi to/from the airport is easiest, but there is cheaper transportation that is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: Shelley52
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for us. It was close enough to easily get to everywhere we wanted to go in Venice but yet when you climb off the Vaporetta at the St Elena stop you have left the busy city and arrived in a lovely quiet setting - you actually would never imagine there to be a large hotel where the St Elena is, it blends in well to the surrounding area because it used to be a convent I believe. The garden rooms are very nice. Not very big but big enough and very tastefully decorated and furnished. Breakfast buffet was good. That's the only meal we had in the hotel. The staff are very efficient and everywhere is spotlessly clean. Couldn't have chosen a better hotel if you want to escape to peace and quiet after a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: Judy025
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, comfortable and spacious and though it's off the beaten path, the vaporetto makes it easy enough to get anywhere. Walking is also an option and there's a beautiful path leading towards town. It's refreshing to stay where it is quiet and in a residential area. The hotel breakfast is delicious with lots of options including eggs, meats, cheeses, croissants, bread, fruit, cereal and gorgeous pastries. The grounds are lovely out back but does not have outdoor seating for dining. The staff was friendly and helpful, but we were a little surprised to find that the air conditioning hadn't been switched over yet from heating.... Fortunately after our first day it was cool enough with the windows open. I would definitely recommend this to fellow travelers. It's a great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, efficient rather than friendly”
Reviews.Author: Soupyfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for three nights from 9th May. The hotel was easy enough to find and a pleasent walk to St.Marks square. It wasn't that the staff were unfriendly they just seemed to be too busy to have a chat and all the answers to our questions were as brief as possible. The bedrooms were excellent and as with the rest of the hotel very clean. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast and there was plenty of choice. We didn't eat in the restaurant as we thought it was a little expensive compared to other restaurants we visited during our stay. I also thought the drinks were a little expensive â‚¬21 for a Bacardi & Coke and a gin and tonic. A big plus was that internet access was free making it handy to check if our flight home was going to take off. If you are travelling from the bus station on the water bus I would suggest the number 41 or 51 to St.Elena but going back take the 42 or 52 as these go straight to the station in about thirty minutes whereas the number 1 takes a lot longer as it goes throught the centre of Venice taking in a lot of stops.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: jatsprie
Reviews.Content: We, 4 ladies, stayed 5 days in the Hotel Sant'Elena. We were surprised. Nice rooms, friendly staff, good food and service. We highly recommend the Hotel Sant'Elena and when we come back to Venice, we love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidseals
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Sant'Elena. It's a smart hotel in a good loctaion away from the hordes of tourists but easy to get to anywhere from. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the room was excellent. Would have no hesitation recommending it and we hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend a stay”
Reviews.Author: Burton23
Reviews.Content: I wife and i stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and would recommend it to friends. It's in a very quiet area of Venice on the far Eastern side of the island close to a park. It's a good 15-20 minutes walk to the square although a very nice walk along the waterfront. Service was consistently good and efficient throughout. We stayed in room 119 off the courtyard/garden and with the daytime temps being in around 25c the direct sunlight made the room very hot. In summary i would stay again. We loved the two cats which were often outside the front doors. Good job.

Reviews.Title: “Fine value in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bretharte
Reviews.Content: Echoing an earlier reviewer, we found this comfortable hotel's peaceful location near a vaporreto stop or a pretty 30 minute walk to the hustle and bustle of San Marco square to be an ideal setting for a visit to Venice. Our room was immaculate and the included breakfast buffet generous and very tasty. Definitely a good value

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in run down area”
Reviews.Author: cobraj
Reviews.Content: I picked this Hotel for our two day stay in Venice because we have a two year old and we did not want a Hotel that had water right next to it and we heard of the park like atmosphere of this Hotel. This is a very nice Hotel but the Best Western website does not show potential guests the extensive grafiti and almost slum like condition of the entire surounding area. On the walk back to the Hotel along the water is a burned out boat with a tv on top of it and other garbage that just sat there. I feel like I have been had. The breakfast was very good but I did not like the coffee so I asked for a expresso which was terrible. Also be advised that the earliest they serve dinner in Venice is 6:30 pm and there are very limited stores near by this Hotel to get foood, drinks or supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: dpark2903
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite the most wonderful place to stay, quiet but in very easy reach of Venice and the islands and the greater Veneto region. Due to travel problems caused by the volcanic eruption we had to extend our stay and the hotel simply could not have been more helpful and kind. We were so pleased to have found this oasis and would certainly stay here on a return trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY OUT OF CROWDS IN VENICE”
Reviews.Author: ALEXRASSI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very calm area and easy to acces walking 30 min or quickly by vaporetos. Close to the other islands like Lido or Murano . If you want a good hotel in a peaceful place , this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Kids liked the Wii!”
Reviews.Author: DebB10
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, it had a pull out out sofa and a double bed. The kids loved the fact that the hotel gave them a stuffed animal when we arrived and they had a Wii in the room to play during our down time. It was a little far off from everything and took over half an hour vaparetto ride from the train station. After we dropped off our suitcases it was not a bad walk back to the main tourist attractions. We found a great restaurant called Ristorante Giorgione in Garibaldi. The owner sang to us while we ate! The walk back to the hotel was a little dark, but nice walking by the water, although the kids were a little scared walking by the park in the dark. The bathroom was nice with a shower/bath and two sinks. Breakfast was excellent with a great selection including eggs and bacon as well as the normal "Italian" breakfast of breads and such.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsabelWChesterfield
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as my daughter and I wanted somewhere quiet but not too far from the main attractions. It was a good choice. The vapporetta stop is very close and the hotel is only 30 minutes ride from Piazza Roma or Santa Lucia. The hotel is very nice, well maintained with good size rooms and bathrooms. The inclusive breakfast was very good with plenty of choices to suit everyone. We had a twin bedded room with two french windows which opened onto the garden. My student daughter was delighted as we each had 30 minutes free internet access each day. The staff wer very helpful and spoke very good English which was goo as my Italian is poor, they willingly gave us directions to restaurants and we were able to store our luggage on our last day as we had an evening flight. I would certainly stay here again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Tibby27
Reviews.Content: I have visited Venice twelve times over the past fourteen years, and this is by far the best hotel that we have ever stayed in. Situated in a good residential area, but very near to San Marco, the hotel buildings are extremely stylish. Bedrooms are impeccable, and I could stay in the bathroom all day! The hotel staff are all extremely courteous and helpful. This is the second time that I've stayed there, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone. If you open your bedroom window at 8.00 am, you should hear the Italian national anthem being played (at the nearby dockyard, I think!) unless it is drowned out by the clamour of church bells! Great breakfast.....I do worry that everyone is going to stay there and I won't get in next time.....

Reviews.Title: “Valuable Alternative to Venice Rip-Off Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: rainbowfishh
Reviews.Content: Nicely located - you will enjoy the more quiet 20 min walk to San Marco after a busy day full of noisy tourists - and nicely equipped. Modern rooms with stylish interieur, clean and well taken care of, friendly staff and a sufficient and rich breakfast buffet. And - you get value for money and don't have to pay the overpriced hotels in the center. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: ijw54
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Sant Elena for two nights,chosen because it was a converted convent. Hotel is easy to get to, we bought a 3 day pass for 33 euros, caught the ACTV no 5 bus from airport to the bus station and then no 51 vaporetto to Sant Elena, the journey took about an hour and half,hotel is just a short walk away from the stop. The hotel is in a very quiet location, lovely green setting,very modern hotel. The room was lovely, beds were extremely comfortable, bathroom warm. Very clean. Breakfast was extensive, large choice of juices, cereals, fruit, cakes, breads, meats, cheese,bacon,eggs, coffee.Staff very polite and helpful and unobstrusive. We needed to use the internet, and got free half hour, also advised us on getting back to airport when we heard about the ACTV strike. Hotel is about 30 mins walk along the canal to St Mark's, or a few minutes on the vaporetto. Venice is extremely easy to get around, having the 3 day pass meant we were able to ride the Grand canal in its entirety (both ways!) and visit Murano with no extra to pay.The city is very clean, hardly any evidence of litter, felt very safe even late at night,very few street vendors. On our last day there was a 3 hour strike by ACTV so in order to get back to the airport we caught the Alilaguna ferry (cost us 13 euros each),took about an hour. Weather in February very similar to Britain. We thought eating out was expensive,although there were a couple of eating places near the Rialto bridge where we had a coffee and pizza for about 7 euros each.All in all, a very good city break holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sal_Jhb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. It is clean, modern and really close to the centre of Venice but far enough away to still be quiet and away from loads of tourists. The value for money is really good and you can walk to the St Mark's square in about 30 minutes. The room is stunning with modern decor and quite large for Europe's standards. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was lovely with pastries, breads, cheeses, cold meats, cereals, eggs, bacon, sausages. I would highly recommend staying there and hope to be back some day!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: AussieAngel1
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. It has been renovated for a modern appeal, but tastefully. We stayed in the junior suite and it was very spacious. The room was clean and had a balcony overlooking the courtyard and a view to the canal nearby. The location is very quiet as was the hotel. The breakfast was very good with cereals, toast, pastries, tea, coffee, juice as well as a warm breakfast. The staff were pleasant and spoke very good English. The price cannot be beaten. Our other option was to stay at a place overlooking the Grand Canal, but we chose this one because of the price and the decor and we very glad that we did choose it. The walk to the main tourist area didn't take too long, about 20 minutes, and there is much to see along the way. You can take the Vaporetto easily with the Sant Elena stop close by, but they can be crowded and we preferred the pleasant walk. We loved the foggy mornings walking along the waterfront. To get to the hotel from the airport is very simple: we took the water bus to Lido and the changed buses to the Sant Elena stop. From the stop follow the diagonal path through the park and then follow the paved street to the end. Look right and down the end is a yellow and brick building. This is the hotel. Just a tip though, when leaving make sure you buy your vaporetto ticket from a ticket point ahead of time. There isn't a ticket point at the stop, but there's a newstand and the price for a ticket was very very expensive from them. The typical ripping off of the tourists in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanuckHorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their two story suite with two queen beds. Room had a small kitchen, and a lovely patio. The bathroom did not include a bath tub. The breakfast was very good. The location is a little too far for walking, but the vaparetto stop is very close, and we never waited for very long for the next boat. The neighborhood does not offer many restaurants or shopping, but there is a very good family restaurant very close. We enjoyed walking though the park, and always seemed to see a dog out playing with its owners.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very good value”
Reviews.Author: traveller55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights just before xmas. I got a great deal via the hotel's own website - a special offer which meant we paid around Â£32 each per night for Bed and Breakfast - an absolute bargain anywhere but especially in Venice. I wondered if there might be a catch, but there wasn't. The hotel is modern, clean and very warm, which was a blessing as it was -5 centigrade outside. I imagine the thick walls will keep it cool in summer. Our twin rooms were well equipped with flat screen tv, tea and coffee making facilities, a mini bar and a good bathroom with nice toiletries. The large breakfast - a buffet with a wide choice including hot food, kept us going for most of the day. Staff were friendly and helpful. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first evening, the food was OK but not highly recommended. We got a 3 day bus/vaporetti pass at the airport and travelled to the hotel first using a number 5 (local ) bus to the Piazzale Romana and then a number 42 boat. This was a very cheap way of travelling (we used it going back as well) as the bus from the airport was included in the 3 day ticket which cost 33 euros each. The hotel is a pleasant 20 minute walk along the waterfront to St Mark's square. The only drawback was that there was virtually nowhere to eat locally, it is a residential area with pleasant gardens and just a couple of bars. We ate in a bar one night and it was perfectly OK, but not a fine dining experience! I would definitely return to this hotel - presumably it's cheaper because it's out of the main tourist areas, but in some ways this is an advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Great Breakfast Buffet and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: kaci99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 1 hour by boat-bus from the train station and it is a wonderful ride down the Grand Canal! Upon arrival at the Lido stop it is a short walk around the corner to the hotel. The hotel is modern and spacious. The bathroom was large by European standards and the rate included a fantastic full American breakfast buffet. It is a 20 min walk from the hotel to San Marcos Square. This was an excellent value and I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel within easy reach of all major Venice attractions”
Reviews.Author: REDFOOT7
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Best Western Premier Hotel Sant' Elena and each time it has been a very pleasant experience. The hotel is easily accessible from the airport by boat requiring one change at Lido. San Marco Square can reached by boat or a very pleasant 20 minute walk along the canal promenade. The rooms were spacious and well appointed with all facilities one would require - tea and coffee, minibar, internet etc. The staff were efficient, friendly and very helpful. A wide range of items were available for breakfast all well cooked and presented. I would definitely recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonLynne
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after trip on number 51 vaporetto and short walk from the San Elena stop - the last before it moves across the water to Lido. The hotel is perfectly situated if you have young children - quiet, easy to find and a lovely green oasis and park just outside. Chloe often played here at the end of the day whilst we had a spritz in the small bar near the park. The hotel itself is modern, large family room, great view over the canal, very nice tolietries. Pleasant walk to the busier areas or easy vaporetto ride. If we came back to Venice again we would definietly stay here - it was our little haven from the hustle and bustle of Venice and great for the islands. Only downside which my husband insists I put was there were no english channels tuned in on the TV - but who needs TV in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel with pleasant courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: duffer04
Reviews.Content: We arrived with friends and found the hotel easily as it was less than a two minute walk from the water bus stop. The walk to San Marco took about 30-40 minutes but there was always the water bus. We enjoyed the quiet neighborhood and the park setting. The large room was comfortable and clean. The breakfasts provided us with many choices and were the best of our two week trip. The tv did not have many offerings but none of the hotels in Italy did. Hey, we were not in Italy to watch television. Overall a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Cheated by Best Western........what a stay.”
Reviews.Author: radders1968
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the Hotel after a 12 week long dialogue with Best Western over our group rate we found that the Hotel charged us all an extra 100eu per room because we had 2 people staying in a double room!!! Surely supplements apply the other way around???...The reception staff seemed prepared for this as soon as we arrived and were extremely rude (especially Angela!!) whoimmediately said that we had booked double rooms for 1 person and that it would be an extra 100eu per room to have the second person stay... We should the conformation we had received from Best Western only to be told that it was correct buy only for 1 person per double room!!!... The recpetionists became quite aggressive and as we had no choice we all had to agree to pay. We are inthe process of complaining to Best Western over their hotels antics.. Other than that the Hotel was in a nice location and clean... The restaurant food was average and extremely pricey and the drink tariff was on par with St Marks square!!!! On the whole our group weekend away for two of our party's 40th Birthday was soured by the Hotels behaviour. Though they advertise on their website an early bird booking, they do not honour this on arrival and leave you no choice at all but to pay the standard rate.. On the whole I would not recommend this hotel and suggest that you avoid Best Western hotels in general. I will certainly not be booking with Best Western again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Serene and Plush!”
Reviews.Author: HeadofSpreesUS
Reviews.Content: This hotel, a former convent, is located at the western end of Venice. The area is not frequented by tourist and is one of the most quiet and serene places in Venice. While it is a 15-20 minute or more walk to San Marco, there is a Valparetto (water bus) station very near and it will take you to San Marco (or anywhere else in Venice) with ease. The hotel itself is well-maintained and the rooms are excellent. Photos of the hotel and the rooms at the hotel's website give you an accurate sense of what the hotel really looks like. The breakfast in the morning was substantial and staff are friendly and very helpful. There is a restaurant, which we ate at one night. It was fairly good, but a little too upscale-ish. We booked and paid in advance, getting a rate that was incredidle for Venice generally, and this hotel in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: CalverleyRhino
Reviews.Content: What a really pleasant hotel, my wife and I stayed at the Best Western Sant Elena for three nights between the 27th and the 30th October 2009. This old Convent has been very nicely converted. A friendly, modern hotel 20 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco or two stops on the Vaporetto. A great location in a quiet residential area, out of the way of the hustle and bustle of the Venice tourist traps, but still a convenient location to see the beautiful city of Venice. The only real disadvantage to the hotels location is the lack of eating opportunities within the immediate vicinity (apart from the hotel), however there are many restaurants about 10 minutes in to the walk towards Venice centre or one stop on the Vaporetto. A superb continental buffet style breakfast with plenty of choice sets you up for a day in Venice. The best bits - the Gondola ride was great. At 80 euros for 40 minutes itâ€™s a bit steep but a must do while in Venice, as is a coffee in Piazza San Marco, again pricy but a pleasant experience. The view from the top of the campanile is fantastic and well worth the admission. The Peggy Guggenheim museum of modern art is also very good. Fancy a drink, head to the famous Harryâ€™s Bar near San Marco for a swanky cocktail. Transport - We purchased the public transport pass at the airport, in the arrivals hall. At 33 euros this allowed us to have unlimited use of the bus and Vaporetto for 72 hours. From the airport take the number 5 bus to the end of the line which is Piazza Roma. Then get the Vaporetto (51 and 61 are the fastest and avoid the Grand Canal) to the Sant Elena stop. The hotel is a two minute walk from the stop. Really easy, about a one hour trip from the airport to the hotel in total. We had a great stay and time in Venice, we would almost certainly stay at the Santa Elena if we return to Venice. Recommended for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Raquel1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October with a group of friends and had a fabulous time. The hotel is very modern in design and our rooms were very clean with good facilities. Breakfast was included in our rate and this was very good with a selection of hot and cold items - the only thing was that the breakfast room got very crowded and as there was 6 of us we never all got to sit together. Easy journey from the airport on the Vaperetto - the S.Elena stop is only a few minutes walk to/from the hotel. We got a 3-day pass on the Vaparetto for 33Euros and this was excellent value for money as we used the Vaperettos all the time so definitely got our money's worth! The hotel is about a 20min walk from St Marks Square but it is a nice walk all along the canal so worth doing. Venice is a great place with lots to see and do and I would definitely recommend the city and the hotel - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: coloradokd
Reviews.Content: Location on far end of island is nice to get out of main squares, however hotel was harder to find. Staff charged us an extra 20euro per person on top of what we had booked online (for some reason I don't remember other than it was to take advantage of tourists). Stains on carpet and bathroom wasn't as immaculate as it should be. I wasn't that impressed by the value we got for how much we paid. Breakfast buffet was extensive though (should be for 20euro a person).

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the hustle bustle of Venice”
Reviews.Author: EBradshaw
Reviews.Content: Get lost in Venice as the old saying goes! You could literally walk round for miles, never passing the same place twice, and this Hotel on Sant Elena is a hidden gem, out of the limelight, so somewhere to relax after a busy day. We stayed for 4 nights on a B&B basis, and found the room very comfortable, modern with tea and coffee making facilities, and free internet too! Breakfasts had a good choice, and our room was very plush, and clean. The Hotel is in a residential family area of Venice, so very safe at night, the only bad point about it's location being it is right in front of a football stadium (Vecchio Ultra) so Sunday's were rather interesting with a Junior Football competition which was very noisy from quite early on. Would definitely recommend, despite it being about 20 mins walk from St Marks/Railto Bridge etc, as it's right on the Vaparetto stops, and also just across from Lido if you fancied going to a beach for the day.

Reviews.Title: “The best night of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: rojos1
Reviews.Content: After almost 24 hours of travel the Hotel Santa Elena was a godsend! The hotel was two minute walk from a beautiful park and the vaporetto stop. The rooms were comfortable and still had the feeling of the old monastery that the hotel once had been. We were there on the night of one of their biggest celebrations with fireworks and partying all up and down the canal yet it was quiet and peaceful at the hotel. The room was great for the four of us, the AC was cold and the view out the windows was darling. Dinner was scrumptious- we ate at the hotel due to the fact that the limited restaurants in the area were already booked due to the Festa de Redentore, that might be the only drawback is the lack of restaurants. However the vaporetto will get you to the main hub in 5-10 minutes or you can hoof it in 20 or so minutes. The concierge were welcoming and spoke enough English to make us comfortable. The only drawback would be I had booked a room for 4 persons through Expedia and somehow the hotel only had reservations for 2 of us. The room was big enough with a queen bed and foldout couch so there wasn't a problem about sleeping arrangements, but it did cost us another 60 euros. As sleep deprived as we were, there was no aruguing about it. i didn't dwell on it and I didn't let it ruin my stay there. Breakfast was a marvel with all sorts of delicious goodies, my teenage boys especially enjoyed the large variety of breakfast meats. Would we stay there again? Yes, in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “It was a beautiful time”
Reviews.Author: BFORTUNATO
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night, accomadations were clean and pretty. Breakfast was great. There is a little cafe around corner for drinks and dinner. We were 10 in our group and had a great time. Would love to have stayed longer. Great location away for everything but near enough to walk to St. Marks. Fortunato's in Florida

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Greigfamily
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in an excellent quiet and peaceful location.Ideal to come back after a busy day in Venice.Reception and bar staff very friendly and helpful but breakfast staff need to cheer up a bit.Room was spacious,cool and clean we stayed for 3 nights and would definately stay here again the next time we are in Venice. The 3 day 33 euro ATVO waterbus/airport bus pass is a great idea and can be bought from the kiosk at Marco Polo Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: EoinIreland
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. So well located in a quiet part of Venice, but within comfortable walking distance of San Marco etc. The room was superbly appointed, the breakfast was delicious, and served up to 11.00am, which is very flexible. It was delicious also. The staff were very friendly and professional. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at Sant' Elena”
Reviews.Author: Leeds007uk
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and excellent as ever. The breakfast is the best we have had in Venice. The rooms are very spacious donâ€™t often get this in Venice. The hotel is in a quite location about 15-20 minutesâ€™ walk to St.Markâ€™s if you feel lazy you can easy catch the vaparetto. There is a family run restaurant just around the corner Dal Pampo â€“the fish was good. We stayed 3 nights and purchased a three day pass for the vaparetto for 33 euroâ€™s. We took the bus from the airport about 20 minutes and then the vaparetto to the hotel. This was all covered by the 3 day pass. A trip across to the Lido is only about 5 minutes and the beach there is lovely. We will be returning again to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: blues_driven
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, breakfast service was very good. Staff were polite and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Solid service and good value”
Reviews.Author: Dudus
Reviews.Content: Choosed BW Premier Sant'Elena as alternative to all the small hotels, which are perhaps located more in centre but also have high prices. Given that we anyway avoid Piazza San Marco for meals and other breaks, this hotel was ideal to stay at - even that it is not a typical "charming" venetian hotel. But location is very nice in a quiet quarter, next Vaporetto-station just a few steps away. Rooms are modern and offers the usual standard in this category - the great plus is absolutely the quietness. Breakfast offers - for italian relation - a rich choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ElecATHENS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in a junior suite - over a long weekend. It is a very conveniently located hotel, 3 stops away from Piazza San Marco and approx. 20 mins walk. We actually preferred the location as it is right next door to the 'Bienale' and opposite the Lido island - plus not as cramped and stuffy as most hotels around San Marco. This hotel is just behind a park area and very pleasant oopen spaces. The rooms actually do correspond to the photos which are uploaded on the site and are pleasantly not at all misleading. Much better 'value-for-money' than a more central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a quiet area not far from the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: SvdhGhent
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. It wasn't in the centre, but there was vaperetto-stop just a few 100 metres from it. But you can easily do all the tourist must-sees by foot (like we did, because the vaporetto isn't that cheap), and the biennale is really nearby..It was also very relaxing to come back in the evening,from a busy day in the centre, to a quiet hotelroom. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The room was clean and had airco (wich was necessairy, because it was really hot outside). The breakfast was great, we had alot of choice (toast, cake, croissants, fresh fruit, cereals, etc etc...). It was super! We'll stay in this hotel again when we come back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: HuSeyn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on a honeymoon trip across Italy and France and had an amazing stay at this hotel. The location is superb (about 10 minutes to San Marco by Water Bus), the island is calm, green, and amazing, and it is at an equal distance between Venice Main stations and the other islands (such as Lido and Murano). The hotel itself is very nice (used to be a convent), rooms are very clean and classy. Staff is very helpful, and breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: ViajanteLisboa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming hotel for two nights, and everything was perfect during our visit. The rooms are very large, elegant and clean, with modern design furniture, and all the amenities you need. The continental breakfast is very rich, and you can have it in the hotel's garden, which is perfect in the morning! This old convent turned into an excellent hotel is set in Sant' Elena's island, in a very quiet location just five minutes far from San Marco (by vaporetto) or fifteen minuted by foot. TO SUM UP, A MIRACLE FOR VENICE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel,excellent location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sajohnson
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a wonderful 4 nights at this lovely hotel. The hotel is a 20 minute walk from St. Marks Square....but a wonderful walk. It is has its own water bus stop. The location is in a nice quiet area...which I know other travelers have commented on. Depending on what your looking for this is either good or not so. For us it was like heaven going back at the end of the day after the hussle and bussle of the Venice. The room were spacious and well done. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful with advice and directions. I plan on visiting again and taking my husband. We will be returning to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Experience In Venice...”
Reviews.Author: BrunoGent
Reviews.Content: This trip was the third to Venice this year. Reason : the Biennale... and... our feelings for this unique town. We have been looking to find a quiet, reasonably price hotel, not to far from Giardini and Arsenale. The only result was... Sant'Elena. For Venice it is an amazing experience : clean, comfortable, nice and helpfull people, a real breakfast (for those who have remarks : should try another hotel in Venice : this is the best breakfast to find in town). What more to say ? We upgrade this hotel with another star in our personal hotelcatalogue and surely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: petervmarle
Reviews.Content: perfect location and excellent stay. Location < 10 min from san marco. If we go back to Venice we surrently go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that gives us what we want year after year”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellersUK
Reviews.Content: We liked the same things we have liked during our previous 3 trips to the Hotel Sant'Elena - which is why we come back every year. We like the proximity to the open lagoon and the vaporetto (waterbus) stop which is only 200m from the hotel. Pity the poor travellers who have to lug heavy baggage around at the start and end of their holidays! The vaporetto runs very frequently, and gets you to St. Mark's Square in 10 minutes (*don't forget to buy your multi-day pass for the vaporetto at the airport - unlimited walk on / walk off trips*). If you feel like stretching your legs, St. Mark's is only a 20 minute stroll away along the lagoon edge, passing the Bienniale Gardens and the Arsenale / Maritime Museum (both worth a look). The food is fine and plentiful, the cleanliness is impeccable, the rooms comfortable and air conditioned, and, being in the only green area of the island, it is fresh. A former convent, the hotel has an enclosed lawned garden which is ideal for peaceful relaxation, sunbathing and breakfast. We are seasoned travellers and are quite demanding when it comes to service and value for money. We also believe that good service should be rewarded by recommendation, and a number of our friends have taken our advice and stayed at Sant'Elena. All have been delighted that the hotel was as good as we said it would be. The low spot during our last stay was that we saw a mosquito there once. If you go in 2010, we may see you there!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel with excellent access to Biennale”
Reviews.Author: BCAGallery
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Venice staying 9 nights at the Hotel Sant' Elena. I was there to attend a conference and to visit La Biennale di Venezia. For Biennale visitors the location could not be better. A quick 5 minute walk to the Giardini or one Vaporetto stop, and 12 to 15 minute walk to the Arsenale or two Vaporetto stops. The Hotel Sant' Elena is tastefully decorated, clean, modern and comfortable and was a wonderful quiet oasis in comparison to the crowds around San Marco. We had a small but very nice comfortable room on the top / attic level with a view of the garden. The complimentary breakfast was generous and had something for everyone and it was lovely to sit outside and eat breakfast in the garden solarium. We would definitely stay here next time we come to Venice and would recommend it to anyone visiting Venice but especially if you are visiting the Biennale.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: ViejoTorrance_CA
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel for its out of the way appeal. It only took us about 25 mins to walk to the square along the waters edge. We had a very comfortable garden room, the breakfast was surprisingly good (compared to the other 2 hotels we stayed at in Italy). We were part of a Globus tour and this hotel was one of the best we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: adrianlitman
Reviews.Content: what a relief to come home to the sant' elena hotel after being in touristy venice all day.!! -the walk from the centre was a pleasure strolling next to the water and passing green trees.Its hard to explain until you have visited venice!! The rooms were nice,the breakfast excellent,and I would definitely stay again,and recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lilaloTLV
Reviews.Content: Since it was our 3rd visit to Venice I must admit our expectations were low. This hotel was a total surprise and a good one. The rooms are spacious, new, and decorated with taste. The air conditioning worked perfectly. The bathroom (shower) is very clean & bright, and large enough. Breakfast was good â€“ even our spoiled teenagers enjoyed it. We took the boat from San-Marko's square â€“ 5 minutes sail - so the distance from the "center" (if Venice has one) is not something I would think about. The neighborhood is peaceful and quiet, and the hotel locates 2 minutes walk from the Vaporetto station. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, If i ever return tto Venice.

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel with friendly and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: vitzWales
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suite with balconies overlooking the hotel garden. The room and bathrom were tastefully decorated and very clean. Breakfasts were good and we had a pleasant dinner in the restaurant. The staff were extremely helpful and sorted out a minor problem immediately. The hotel was a pleasant walk or short waterbus ride away from St Mark's Square. Altogether a great hotel representing good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: fourcourt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a quiet residential district on the Eastern fringe of Venice. Not as far from San Marco as other reviews might imply - 10 mins on the Vaporetto You would need to be monumentally lazy or impatient to consider that 'too far'. The staff were unfailingly courteous and patient. The real test of a hotel comes if you have a complaint, and in this the Sant'Elena passed with flying colours. We were assigned a very small room with a double bed on arrival - two gents. We had also needed a smokers room but Hotelclub.net does not provide a facility for requesting that. We said we were not happy, but to be fair, we had arrived late - 10.30 pm, and they had no other rooms available. The next day they moved our luggage into a very nice garden room with separate beds for the rest of our stay - not very much bigger, but better laid-out for space. Not even a hint of annoyance from them. Well done, and thank you! Breakfast was up to the standard as any other hotel on the continent. There is, as other reviewers point out, a nice friendly pizza restaurant/bar around the corner. The vaporetto stop (a 2-min walk) has direct connections to everywhere else in Venice and Murano/Lido. The airport boat has a nearby connection at the Arsenale stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pippolitto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Sant'Elena for 4 nights and really enjoy our break. The hotel is located in the very quite residential area of Sant'Elena, but you can see San Marco from the vaporetto stop ( only 2 minutes walk from the hotel) and use the campanile as landmark if you wish to walk to San Marco and the city centre. We purchased a 72 hours ticket and travelled everywhere and really made the most of the lovely sunshine! We booked the hotel on the Best Western site and got a special rate because we paid in advance. The price was ok for Venice, the hotel was clean, our room was really nice and spacious, breakfast was good, but I wish we could have used the tables outside as the room god a bit hot. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. We did not use the hotel for drinks or dinner as it did not have a designated bar area and we didn't like the dinner menu. We found a great little restaurant only a few minutes from the hotel, Osteria al Pampo and we went back every night! It was full of regulars and we met an old couple from near Oxford that had travelled every night of their 5 day stay ,from San Marco, to have dinner there!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: mandy61
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel and it was OK. I agree with the previous review regarding value for money, we too got a deal and had we paid full price, we would have been dissapointed. The hotel was clean, the rooms OK however, it lacks public areas and to us, just had a overall feeling of being 'un-loved'. The positives are it is in a good location, just a short walk to the vaporetto stop, one stop to/from the Lido and 10 mins to/from San Marco. Alternatively, it is approximately a half hour walk to San Marco at a gentle pace. It is close enough to the city however, far enough away to get a good nights sleep (I have stayed by San Marco in the past and it is very noisy!). The breakfast is also very good with a superb selection of hot and cold food, juices and coffee - it really sets you up for the day. If you do not wish to splash out on a water taxi from the airport, the quickest journey to the hotel is via the water bus to the Lido and the vaporetto to Saint Elena. We purchased the 72 hour pass (at the Lido) for 33 euros and it was good value for money. I can't say we found a really good restaurant - the best meal we had was at one of the restaurants by the Rialto on the bank of the Grand Canal. I think this hotel is very probably best suited for families.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay here. Spacious rooms, great breakfast, helpful staff, great value. AAA+++”
Reviews.Author: AVIATRIXXX
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely three night stay at the Best Western Sant Elena Hotel. My husband and I were in a junior suite on the first floor. Rooms were very clean and spacious. Bathroom had a tub and also a bidet with two sinks. The mattress was very firm. Park nearby water was nice. There is a good pizza place around the corner. The water bus stop is very close by and very easy to get around Venice by water bus, about 10 minutes on the water bus to St. Marks Square area. We took a private water taxi from the airport which was 80 euros expensive but only took 30 minutes. Breakfast was plentiful with a great selection of fruit, cereal, cold cut meats, cheeses, mozzarella, tomatoes, toast, pastries, juice, coffee, made to order expresso and cappicino, eggs, sausage and much more. The staff was very courteous and helpful at all times. We prepaid in advance on their website and saved on the rate. It cost us about $600.00 USD total for the three nights. We would definitely stay here when we visit Venice again and would recommend this hotel to others. Thank you for a wonderful visit!

Reviews.Title: “quiet, big rooms, easy access by water taxi GREAT breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: deejayrussia
Reviews.Content: we arrived and had ants in one of our three bedrooms. They were as horrified as us so they relocated us. Good staff. Good location b/c you take water taxi anyway, quiet. Breakfast was great, which is nice when you take extended family, everyone was pleased! We had a baby in the group-it was great. The fold out couch bed was disappointing-not comfortable but the rest of us slept great...

Reviews.Title: “gooooooood”
Reviews.Author: PANDAFrankfurtAmMain
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 2night and fist tirp to venice. San elena is just 2station from san marco and hotel is located 3min walk from waterbus station. hotel was modern and clean . i walk from hotel to san marco and it tooks around 15min. the view from hotel to sant marco is so nice i did not really care the distance. it was pleasant to stay there and i will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay the full price!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMegan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all round OK, if i had paid full price i would have been Extremely annoyed!!!! however having paid a reduced rate for a supposed suite ( or what i would call a very very average room) it wasn't bad value, but it was a good 25 minute walk into the centre, this isn't a problem though the walk is quite nice and the boats are very frequent and run until late. The hotel staff were a mixed bunch there were some that were extremely rude and unhelpful and a couple that were pleasant and quite friendly. The restaurant was weird! no music at dinner or breakfast! very odd and only one member of staff who i had to ask to come and serve us, the hotel overall had no charm or character and wasn't really that modern but you will be out that much during the day that it is ok really nothing major to moan about really. Bar wise i can highly recommend Central Bar!!! and we also enjoyed Bacaro Jazz both really lovely fun bars in a city which proves difficult to find nightlife this tip could be valuable! Had a great time here! Murano island is lovely and the Peggy Guigenhiem was really good as some extras after you have done the main tourist attractions which are really worth seeing!

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again to far from st mark square”
Reviews.Author: traveller81England
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and clean but it was quite far from the centre, to far to walk. Same of the staff were nice some were not ,the food in the hotel was not great., The rooms and bathrooms were nice the hotel was out of the way. i would prob give this hotel for location a 3 out of ten, for cleaness a 9 and for the stafff an 7.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: ChalmersChester
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay, in a junior suite at the excellent Sant'Elena. Hotel staff were both friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable, spacious, quiet and clean. Breakfast room large and airey; excellent selection in the breakfast buffet (great coffee). A 2 minute walk to the vaporetto stop/or a leisurely 15/20 minute walk into St. Mark's square, so perfectly located. One stop away from the Lido (6 mins) where there is a good selection of bars and restaurants, a cheaper alternative than the city centre. We paid 10 euros for a return bus ticket from Treviso airport into the centre and 33 euros for a 72 hour travelcard which covered vaporettos and buses and this was excellent value. We would not hesitate in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DVC1959
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Sant Elena with my wife and 2 kids. We got the large 2 story room at the top floor with a patio and great view. The staff were all very helpful. Nice quiet location but close to vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the city centre but quiet locality”
Reviews.Author: bhromonpagol
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here if you have only a day or two in Venice. Its at the eastern end of Venice and the 1.5 kms to city centre shall be atleast 40 mins crossing 8 bridges which is quite impractical with a kid. Vaporetto is very convenient though can be a bit costly. However if you are looking to spend a few days away from the crowd in Venice, it can be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a quiet and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: xxxxxxzxxxxxxxx
Reviews.Content: The â€˜Hotel Sant' Elenaâ€™ is a pleasant hotel in a converted monastery in a quiet residential area just south of the Biennale Park, about twenty minutes walk from San Marco. The hotel is handily place for the S Elena vaporetto stop. The area appears to be a 1920s development; very quiet except when the local football club, â€˜SS Calcio Veneziaâ€™, are playing just across the road; er; canal. They are, apparently, rubbish. The hotel is well furnished in a rather bland manner that seems to be fashionable these days. The monotony is relieved by numerous artworks, including no less than five pleasant and doubtless expensive lithographs in our room, number 218. A glance at the floor plan indicates that bedrooms are all shapes and sizes (as befits a non-purpose-built hotel) and ours was pleasantly large with a nice seating area with two arm chairs, a settee and a coffee table. The hotelâ€™s own web site offers better rates than the â€˜Best Westernâ€™ website. Specific plus-points are; â€¢ Free broadband connection; Ethernet in all rooms plus wi-fi in some. In a city that is famed for its rip-off internet costs this is a definite plus, even if the hotel policy of dolling out connectivity for twenty-four hours at a time makes this a little more complicated than it need be. â€¢ Free tea and coffee making facilities in every room, with a real kettle. Although becoming more common, this is still far from standard across continental Europe. Here, they will even provide fresh milk if asked. â€¢ Excellent breakfast buffet. Not only is it a huge spread from bacon & eggs through cereals, bread, meats and cheese through to cakes and pastries; it is all very high quality. The restaurant offers reasonable if somewhat limited fare at prices that are appropriate to a hotel of this class. Service can be somewhat lackadaisical, and drinks are overpriced; â‚¬ 5 for an ordinary bottle of beer is outrageous. Surprisingly, this restaurant is closed on Sundays. What purports to be a four-star hotel really should be able to provide meals seven days a week. I am bemused by the comment of the previous reviewer of this hotel that â€˜nearby restaurants were limited and not good, serving mainly localsâ€™. A very good tip is to go precisely where the â€˜localsâ€™ go; they are not daft, they certainly know much more about the area and its restaurants than you and they probably have a disinclination to be ripped off or to suffer poor food and/or bad service. It must be remembered that one of the attractions of this hotel is that it is away from the tourist circuit, so â€˜localsâ€™ will inevitably predominate in this area. And a very good thing that is, too. In truth there are not many restaurants near the hotel, but there is one very close by that is a gem. Looking across the park towards the vaporetto landing stages is the â€˜Vecia Ginaâ€™. This local bar provides a choice of over forty different pizzas and provides the visitor with a glimpse of everyday Venetian life away from the tourist masses. But not on Wednesdays; their day off. The via Garibaldi (ten minutes walk away) provides a pleasant walk but its restaurants are to be avoided as many are rip-off merchants. These are easy to tell as, unusually for Italy, their prices do not include a service charge, which they the slap on at 12.5% to 15%. These places can be expected to try every trick in the book to squeeze extra Euros out of you; for example, by â€˜inadvertentlyâ€™ giving you a much more expensive bottle of wine than you expected. Counter-intuitively, the easiest place to find reasonable restaurants (as well as local shops) is one stop on the Vaporetto away from Venice at the Lido.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, smart, but rather impersonal hotel.”
Reviews.Author: capitalstraveller
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel, looking for a quiet location for the Carnevale: this matched expectations and was near to the local vaporetto stop (though the parkland might be a haven for mosquitos in the summer?). Generally very efficient, and with a better than average buffet breakfast in the spacious restaurant. This seemed to be little used in the evenings, but was OK when we used it. Staff in general were efficient and helpful, but only when asked! Room 412 had a good lagoon view through the trees and was spacious and well-furnished, though with only two English TV channels (as usual!). Nearby restaurants were limited and not good, serving mainly locals? Except Hostaria Franz. But Via Garibaldi area has some nice ones, probably a bit cheaper than in the centre - Nuovo Galleon (reviewed in the London Telegraph) is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Quieter Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: First of all, being from the US, Best Westerns definitely aren't considered upscale or really much more than a 2- or basic 3-star hotel. But after reading about this hotel and other reviews, I figured out that BWs in other countries are a bit different. The hotel has a nice location, a bit further out of town, but a very quiet area with a lot of space and a nice park. You're only about 2 minutes from the vaporetto water metro to take you 2 stops into the heart of the action. But you definitely are on the main Venice island which makes a difference b/c you can easily walk into town in 20 minutes. It's a really nice walk since you have water on one side and there's a waterfront path that for about 1/3 of the way has a garden/park on the other side. Venice itself is made up of so many small alleyways that it can get really crowded and chaotic. I think it worked out perfectly to be stayed a bit outside of this area. There were still a lot of restaurants on this main street that about 5-10 minutes from the hotel. The hotel itself is located one block from the vaporetto (if you walk straight back from the vaporetto stop, through the park, it's one block up from there). The entry way is nice and we were met at reception where someone took our luggage up separately and showed us to our room. The decor was really nice, slightly modern -- very different than i would normally expect from BW. We had booked a really great deal that included breakfast and a free room upgrade to a superior room, but when we arrived, we found we had been further upgraded to a 2-level suite! On the bottom level was a little kitchenette and full-size fridge. There was also a TV and 2 single beds. Then there was a full staircase up to the main bedroom which had a huge closet, good size bathroom and a lot of space in the bedroom area. We also got a huge patio that was basically the size of the bedroom! it had a patio set that would have been great to wine or dinner outside, but the weather wasn't good enough for that. Our place was very nicely decorated like the rest of the hotel. The breakfast was great. There were numerous options like hot items, cold meats and cheeses, fruits, cold cereal. Some things were better than others, but there was more than enough to choose from that you could be happy (and full) until the afternoon. The staff was helpful in giving suggestions for restaurants and transportation, etc, although we did hear several other people get directed to the same restaurant for dinner... not sure if it was just one of the only places open this time of year, but you always like to think that they take what you say you're looking to into consideration and not just give their standard response. Service overall was good at the hotel, just a few really small problems that kept me from giving this a 5/5. The hotel doesn't have many staff on hand, which I guess I can understand b/c it was Jan, however the breakfast room was rather crowded so it definitely wasn't just us staying there. It was about 11pm on the first night when I realized we'd forgotten to bring toothpaste so I called down to the front desk and they said they had some, but no one was there to bring it up to us... not a huge deal, but my husband and I were already ready for bed so we didn't want to go down there. The next morning they brought it up no problem. They also had the blowdryer attached to the wall which is my hotel pet peeve b/c they are always like 800 watts or something ridiculously slow. I know this wasn't a 5-star hotel so i don't have huge expectations, but when the wall blowdryer didn't work, I was somewhat relieved, hoping they'd send up a better one. They sent up a mini dryer, probably about the same wattage but i tried it in about 5 different plugs and it wouldn't turn on. Now I was annoyed and a little embarassed to call down yet again, but with wet hair, I did. The woman said she'd sent someone up but I don' t know if she reset the plugs or what b/c then the blowdryer just started up. Overall they just seemed a bit stingy though. For example, when we checked out, they asked several times to confirm that we had left the blowdryer in the room. We had also called down for a wineopener and the guy stood at the door while we opened our bottle of wine as he said 'it was their only opener' ... These things are not a big deal and didn't disrupt our stay at all, they're just the types of service that lead me to give a 4 instead of a 5/5. We would definitely choose this hotel again as the price we paid was great for what we got. Venice hotels are expensive, especially the nicer hotels on the main island of Venice. we liked the location and found it very easy to get into town. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A best kept little St Mark's Sq secret”
Reviews.Author: Luke123Australia
Reviews.Content: Located literally just off St Mark's Sq, by the Post Office, and being an 'adjunct' of the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal this accommodation was a great surprise. The rooms are not large but they are very modern and of high quality. The lobby is almost non-existent , just the doorman and access control, and breakfast and administration is conducted at the main hotel about 3 to 5 mins walk away. You could be no closer to St Mark's square with its attractions and restaurants etc if you tried. This accommodation was a delight, so unexpected on what was after all a package tour! Luke123Australia

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sant'Elena”
Reviews.Author: MB25Houston
Reviews.Content: We hard a hard time finding a hotel that would be inside of Venice (not on the main land), reasonnably priced, and with a modern feel to it. Best Western Sant'Elena seemed to fit the bill so we booked it. And it was a great choice ! The only inconvenient is that it's a bit far away from the center of the city. This is all relative as we are still in Venice and only 3 vaporetto stops from the heart of the city. The room was decorated with taste, in a zen-inspired style. There's a terrace accessible to everybody to sit in the sun, or you can go down in the garden where there are some chairs too. The breakfast is excellent and can be taken either inside or outside. The staff was very helpful and hooked us up with somebody when we wanted to go visit Murano - we went on a private, free boat ride ! If you like to walk, the walk to San Marco is very pleasant, through Biennale gardens. A place to recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience”
Reviews.Author: Emnero
Reviews.Content: We had the great fortune to spend 3 wonderful days at this Hotel in September. The place is spotless, the staff friendly and the neighborhood full of local colour. Great pizza next door and resonably priced as it is out of the tourist centre which is very pricey. Our room was large with a large bathroom and comfy beds. Excellent breakfast included in the price of the room. The 20 minute walk to St. Marks is a great way top start day as it is through a park and then along the canal with great views. Tip- Book and pay for your room in advance and you will get a good discount. Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “The pizza next door is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CAnn9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really cool. I like the circular stairs, great breakfast and free internet (no, not all day but 30 min.) that they provided. Also, the pizza place (sorry, can't remember the name) next door is awesome. We were going to eat dinner but thought the prices too high. Otherwise, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BindyB
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this lovely hotel with extremely clean, exremely comfortable rooms. In addition, there was tons of closet space and a HUGE bathroom.
