It's off the beaten path, so be prepared for about a twenty minute walk to St. Mark's Square. Don't worry though, it's a lovely walk along the canal with beautiful views. If you don't want to walk, there is a vaporetto stop a two minute walk from the hotel. The continental breakfast included scrambled eggs and ham, in addition to sweet rolls, cold cuts and fruit. Really excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and very peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Holly_82
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in Venice for a weekend and booked this hotel based on the reviews we had read off this site. We were not disapointed at all - we arrived about 9:30pm on the Friday and were greeted by very friendly staff at reception and a porter showed us straight to our room. Our room was very clean, comfortable and functional - flat screen TV, air conditioning - there was a mini bar but it was locked as we didn't really need anything in there. The bathroom was clean, fresh towels and although a couple of the tiles were cracked and the shower was basic, it was more than adequate. We had room 120 and it was a garden room, it was very peaceful Breakfast was perfect - loads of things to choose from the breakfast buffet, odd croissants with apricot jam in them, meats, cheese, tea, coffee etc (we nicked a couple of bread rolls to feed to the pigeons in St Marks Square!) The only thing that was slightly negative was the restaraunt. The food was good and reasonably priced but it took 50 minutes for it to arrive - that could be due to the fact we only got to the restaurant at 9:45pm and had to wait 15 mins for a table to become ready. However, the staff were polite and helpful and as we were very tired from travelling, we were just greatful for food. Yes, it is a bit of a walk to the center of Venice but we walked in, and got a Vaperetto back which was 6.50 Euros each - hardly that expensive and I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a must if planning to see Venice”
Reviews.Author: courtmac62
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, 15mins by foot from St Marks. Staff really good, Breakfast 5*, very peaceful.Hotel 200 meters from waterbus stop Sant' Elena which is the last stop before Lido, and that worked out great as we hit the tourist spots early morning and spent remainder of day on beach. Recommend you see Venice from the waterbus along with by foot.The only disappointing aspect was the Hotel Restaurant, trying too hard! Mark & Tracy de F.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SaskatchewanRusty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were to Italy for the first time this summer and the location of the hotel was excellant. The rooms were extremely clean, quiet and spacious and the hotel staff were extremely helpful as well. Just a short walk along the waters edge to the St. Mark's Square in Venice. We took a water taxi the hotel from the airport which was a little ways away but an experience in itself. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “OK...”
Reviews.Author: MillicentMP
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I was expecting a bit more. Rooms was OK, although we were upgraded to a Jnr Suite, it was still not better than average. The staff is not very friendly or helpful.The restaurant was closed the entire time we stayed there, so could only have breakfast in the hotel. The breakfast was pretty average as well, loads of bread and cokes, but not a lot of variety. The bar was not that good either. For a 4* hotel, I was expecting a bar fully capable of at least making a classic cocktail such as a Margarita! This hotel is nothing more than average. Pleasant, but won't return to it again...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsAKent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for our honeymoon, and I can honestly say that the only bad thing was having to leave. We had a courtyard room which was gorgeous, and every morning we had our (very substantial) breakfast in the gardens. We found the staff to be warm and helpful, we loved the area too and in spite of some people in previous reviews saying that the hotel was too far from St Marks Sq, we found the walk to be enjoyable. I would definitely return to this hotel, in fact I would be on the next flight if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Sant'Elena good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrandPoohbaH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at beginning of August 2008 and found the staff to be most helpful. On arrival we should have had Tea & Coffee facilities in the room but nothing there, went to reception and asked and the above was delivered within 2 minutes of asking. Drain in room 103 was a bit on the smelly side and again requested bleach and this was again done promptly. Only slight hassel that we encountered was that we had to ask every day at reception for milk, but again this was no great hassel. Room was small but acceptable for long weekend stay. Continental Breakfast choice was very good with very good waiter service. On arrival at Airport suggest you pre-book a Water Taxi that you can share with others, we did this with www.viator.com. and it cost 94 dollars, and we got dropped off at the Sant Elena Pier no more than 100 yards from the Hotel only 30 minutes after leaving airport. If you take the normal water Bus (12euros) it will take 1 hour to reach the LIDO then you need to transfer to the No.1,51 or 52 bus to take you to Sant Elena (2 euros). Yes the hotel is 20-25 minutes walk to St Marks Square, but hey your on holiday so enjoy the walk, if you do not want to walk every time then we bought a 3 day Water Bus pass for 31 euros each and found this great value for money as we constantly hopped on and off depending where we wanted to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Sant Elena, Best Western”
Reviews.Author: shock123
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for families with young children. 15 minutes from San Marco and a stones throw from vapretto, 1 stop away from Lido. Excellent location and great layout of hotel. Would stay again. Perfect for families as park is just outside and hotel itself has grounds which other hotels in mainland Venice do not have. Breakfast has wide selection of cold breakfasts from yogurts to croissants and breads. Very clean and modern looking and bathrooms in junior suite were huge. Well worth the money for families with children. Lido is lovely beach close by so if you spend more than three days in Venice you can combine a great city break with a beach holiday. Italians in Venice do not seem to give the best advice but we made friends with some local bengalis who helped us tremondously and am thankful to them.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2002
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here the beginning of June for 3 nights with a tour group. We had one of the rooms that had an entrance from the courtyard and was ground level. It was very pleasant to come & go from our room. One of the afternoons we just took time to relax on the lounge chairs in the courtyard (are available to all guests) - that was very enjoyable. We were very pleased with the room. I must note the room is a typical size European hotel room. Ours was smaller than some that our group had been given. Their rooms were in the main building. But you can't have everything - we loved the courtyard. We had a welcome dinner in the dining room that was excellent for a catered meal - both the food and the service. My husband & I also found the buffet breakfasts very good. We were able to get a cappucino every morning. We did find it took about 20 min. to walk to San Marco square. Most of the time we walked but on occasion took the boat taxi.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: WestMidlandsSandra
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Venice with Easy Jet through Thomsons city Break. Firstly the best way to arrive at your hotel is by pre booked transfers COST Â£21 each way per person, speedy water taxi transfer to your hotel. You can get water taxi on arrival at Marc Polo airport cost 90 euro each way or public water bus Â£12 euro(slow journey). Venice if fantastic arrived at hotel at the end of venice island away from the crowds, situated 50 yards from sant Elena water bus stop in a residential area. Hotel room was large with Queen size bed, very clean and excellent air conditioning, very contempary black and white modern. Hotel bar and resturant serving breakfast mostly continental with cooked bacon,toast machine, cereal, yougot, cake ,cold meats, fruit, tea coffee juices. Evening meal are expensive but so is most of Venice, we had a wonderful meal on our first night followed by a stroll to St Mark sq approx 30 mins stroll where Sir Elton John was in concert live outside in St Maro FANTASIC. Venice doesn't smell even at 30 degree plus, stroll around the tiny street, with shops ands stalls, churches, see as much culture and museums as you want or just enjoy Venice as we did. (map require) Get a water bus ticket cost 21 euro 36 hours hop on and off when you like tour the grand canal and if you get lost hop on water bus and back to a point you know. Cross the Ritalo Bridge to the fruit market and stalls, the views are fab. A gondonla is a must 100 euro for 35 mins but you have to do it. We had a day on beach at Lido which was great after a sight seeing for two days and nights walking. 29 euro for 2 sunbeds and umberella but well worth it, there is a public beach (free) no beds. The Lido is 5min water bus from sant Elena. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a be just outside the madding crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel too far from everything”
Reviews.Author: elleAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel on a Globus tour, the room was nice but small. Bathroom very nice, but a smell like sewerage started emanating from bathroom after a few days. Staff very courteous, but breakfast was the worse meal we had throughout all our 4 weeks in Europe. If you want a ATM or Supermarket you have at least a 20 minute walk, though we were informed 5 minutes. Two or three restaurants in area, but it is at least 40 minutes walk from St. Marks's Square, and other restaurants are at least 20 minutes walk. If you dont feel like walking it will cost you to take the water bus everytime you want to go anywhere. NIce hotel, but if you want to see the main sights of Venice and dont want to do a lot of walking, I wouldn.t recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMartinOriginals
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2008 and had such a wonderful time!!! The hotel was easy to find and located in such a quaint and quiet residential neighborhood. An easy and short walk to the vaporetto, we sometimes took it to get to places, but most of the time we just walked to the main part of the city on foot. It took about 20 minutes to walk, but the walk was on flat ground so it was simple for people who like to walk. The hotel itself was charming. The front desk staff were nice and helped us arrange our luggage to be delivered to our room, as the Lufthansa airline (Frankfurt) lost it initially. We had no problems with check in, which only took a few minutes. We stayed on the 4th floor in a huge room facing the courtyard. It was too quiet to be true. I never heard a single noise the entire time we stayed there, so either the walls were extremely thick or we just had no neighbors. The bathroom was a good size and very clean. All the facilities were very new and modern. All regular conveniences were provided: TV, hair dryer, closet was large, etc. The beds were very comfortable as well. Breakfast was excellent! I had fresh mozzerella balls every morning, with fresh tomatoes and boiled eggs. There were also assorted meats and cheese and various pastries. All in all, an excellent stay!! I have to brag about the neighborhood this hotel is located in. We walked around several times and encountered probably less than a handful of people. It is such a charming residential area, located next to a lovely park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Morbiato
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a week and loved it! BIG bedrooms - it's a ex-convent -and excellent room servicing besides a very helpful staff; free ethernet connection and huge selection on a help yourself buffet for breakfast every day. Wonderfully situated out of the usual tourist areas and only 100 yards or so from the No: 1 waterbus stop which is less than 10 minutes from San Marks Square [and which runs every ten minutes] ; we walked to the Square quite easily within 15-20 minutes. One of the best Pizzarias we've ever been to very close - the hotel will point you in the right direction. Would be very happy to stay there again as we judged it to be a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fsdiss
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. We couldn't find a thing wrong with it. The staff was wonderful, the amenities were great (breakfast as well as the dining room). The location was very good - just a pleasant walk about 20 minutes from San Marco. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighborhood, nice rooms, no crowds”
Reviews.Author: el-gringo1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a residential neighborhood outside the city center. Hence no smelly canals in the summer time. Approx.. a 15 minute walk from St. Marcus Square, there is also a boat stop nearby. Very comfortable rooms (ours faced the courtyard). Belongs to the Best Western Premiere hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: GotABigDog
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal spot to stay if you want to be able to escape from the crowds and tourism of the popular areas of Venice. The hotel is located in one of the only green areas on the island, and is a very short walk from the Sant'Elena vaporetto stop. It is an easy walk to walk to St. Mark's square (15 min.), and several neighborhood restaurants and cafes are close by. The building itself is a former convent, and is very well kept. The interior is soothing and modern. Our room was very clean and much larger than most European bathrooms (including a tub). The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the breakfast was FABULOUS, with many hot selections as well as cereals, yogurt, fruit, etc. I can't say enough about how happy we were to escape the crowds of the St. Mark's/Rialto area and relax here in the afternoons during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: jmc27
Reviews.Content: Mixed thoughts about this hotel. Booked a deluxe room through the hotels web site and went with high expectations having looked at the photos on the web site. However was very disappointed to be given what must have been the smallest room in the hotel - not even a bath but only a shower! Air con was also a problem as it was not possible to get it below 20 degrees and this was too hot for us - we had to sleep with the window open.Reception assured me we had been allocated the correct standard of room and yes they did give a top floor room as requested. The larger rooms looked much better. Breakfast was okay but again not the standard I was expecting. To add to this on our first day we were offered a seat at the bar to eat breakfast as the room was full. The hotel is used by an american tour operator and this means it can get very busy - it also means that they are up and out early and we were wakened every morning by this. We liked the location of the hotel as it is a lovely walk along the front to the busy areas and as everyone has said the water bus stop is close by. I thought the hotel was okay but not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very calm and Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RCaros
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Sant`Elena Hotel in Venice during Carnival in February. The hotel is located in a very quiet neighborhood and near to the vaporetto stop. The location is very romantic because the streets are almost empty and you think that Venice is all yours. We booked at the Best Western website and payed in well advance. Everything was ok with the reservation. We were afraid of that, because we found a very competitive price some months before our stay. Near Carnival, the prices were very high. The room was very, very small, but confortable. I guess it was the smallest in the hotel!! The breakfast room was sometimes full because of the weekend of Carnival. But on Monday and Tuesday, it was almost empty. The best was the scrambled eggs. The bread, sometimes, was like a rock. But, OK! I think this hotel is a very good option. ItÂ´s in Venice. You can walk or take a vaporetto to San Marco. And you can explore other places in the city or Murano and Burano without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel ... be careful of the location”
Reviews.Author: boomerangturtle
Reviews.Content: If there is one word that we can use to describe this hotel then it is "functional". Our room was clean, well kept and certainly met our expectation. It was also good to see the inclusion of tea/coffee making facilities ... which is uncommon in our experience of European hotels. The staff themselves were polite and helpful ... though lacked warmth of personality. A good selection of foods were available for breakfast. Our overall impression was that of a good, functional hotel, but lacking charm and character. The hotel is worth considering but bear in mind it's location. You can't easily pop into the centre... it takes a good 20 to 30 mins to walk to St.Mark's Square ... and most of the tourist sites are there or on the other side of town. This time can however be reduced by using 'vaperetto' (public boats) which has a stop just near the hotel. It can also pose a problem if your flight home is early in the day from Trevisio airport, as the logistics of getting there means a very early start.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: addersDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from 4 nights at the Sant Elena and weren't disappointed. It is a lovely, clean hotel with great service. The location was convenient and quiet and the room was spacious and modern. Not so good was the breakfast which was very ordinary and the lack of a proper bar with comfy chairs - you use the dining room. All in all though very good - we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LauraR4
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel - our room was really spacious and the staff where very helpful. We found the best way to get from the airport was to get the waterbus to Lido and then change at Lido to public waterbus line 1 - Sant Elena is the first stop and the hotel is literally a minutes walk from here. We didn't bother with the day passes for the waterbuses as it was only a 20 minute walk to St Marks Square and you just walk along the waters edge so it was lovely and relaxing! We did get the waterbus a few nights up to San Marco but the ticket booth was closed and nobody asked to see our tickets!! If you come out of the hotel and turn left and then left again, there is a small pizzeria and bar - it doesn't look like much from outside but we found it was great value for money and was just as good as the food at San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all as it used to be!”
Reviews.Author: WombatZ
Reviews.Content: Not what it used to be! We started staying at St. Elena in 2003 when it first opened and was run by private people. At that time it was a wonderful and friendly place to stay. Then it got sold to Best Western. We have been back every year and unfortunately it has changed a lot. Unfriendly staff, dismal breakfast and especially the rooms which used to be beautiful are getting more and more run down. I booked a junior suite via their website an was given a double room when we got there. When I complained they showed me a form where the double room was registered a a junior suite. But the room we got was a double room on their website. So it's all very misleading. As we travel to Venice every year, we'll have to find a new hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: kittenmagic
Reviews.Content: If you like a lovely hotel with great staff with a contemporary feel I would highly recommend this hotel. Sant'Elena is a quite area of Venice which is about 20 min/ half an hour walk from St Marks Sq or you can easily get the handy water bus (6 Euros) which is a stones throw from the hotel. The rooms are newly decorated, very clean, well equipped and breakfast was lovely too. If you like modern hotels that still have a bit of character and don't mind a bit of walking then this hotel is perfect for you. There are one or two restaurants in the area and the great thing about them is that they are not too touristy. Other than these, it is a walk into the main tourist areas where the prices are hiked up and then some... I would not think twice about recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but a little removed from city”
Reviews.Author: MillicentD
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights at the hotel last November and had no problems with it at all - the room was spacious, good bathroom, breakfast was fine. The location was peaceful (which i think is rare in Venice!) but a little far away from everything. You can walk it or get a vaporetto but after a day walking around the city it seems too far to go there and back if you want a break before dinner. If you are looking for somewhere away from everything this is the place to go. If you want somewhere lively I wouldnt recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: madge002
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a wonderfully romantic week in Venice and I was lucky enough to have been treated to a stay at the Hotel Sant 'Elena. I was very impressed from the beginning not least because it is situated only 5 minutes walk from the water bus stop, which are also very frequent. The reception staff were friendly and helpful as in fact the staff were prior to our arrival assisting us with many questions we had. The lobby is light and airy and the resturant where breakfast is served is pleasent, we did have breakfast outside one morning but this was slightly spoilt by the pidgeons. There is a wonderful spiral staircase which for the David Baileys amongst us offers some great photo opportunites. The rooms are clean airy and bright and our room had a small balcony although the view was limited it was still a nice additions. Our only grumble was the housekeeping (the little extras) We ran out of loo roll (most disturbing) and we kept having to ask for milk as none left in room. However on the plus side as most European hotels dont have coffee making facilites having to go to ask for the milk was a minor detail. The breakfast was good, only continental but plenty to have. Also DO try the scrammbled egg, dont be put off by the look of it, it is a must try. So overall I would recommend this hotel anytime and if as I hope I return to Venice which I adorded I would definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Dee0987
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sant'Elena as part of a tour group. The rooms were clean and spacious with modern bathrooms. We stayed in a suite on the 5th floor with beautiful beams in the ceiling and charming views of the canal and neighborhood. Breakfast buffet was fair, but I never could find a hotel in Italy that could cook scrambled eggs or crisp bacon. Go with the Italian breakfast foods- cheeses, breads, yogurt and fruit. Staff was a bit on the snooty side, but helpful enough. The hotel is located about 1/2 mile from the busy San Marco Square, in a quiet area near a large park. There is a small pub around the corner to sit outside in the evenings. Vaporetto (water bus) stop is close by, but one can easily walk to the busy part of Venice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jmjo48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Sant'Elena in early October and had a wonderful stay. It was very clean and comfortable. The room was large (even by American standards) with modern furnishings and well decorated. The bathroom was huge! It had a double sink and thick towels and good toiletries. This was by far the best hotel we stayed in during our trip in Italy. The breakfast was fantastic - there was an actual breakfast buffet by American standards with eggs, sausage, doughnuts, croissants, etc. There was also a coffee and tea bar. The breakfast room is their restaurant in the evening and breakfast was included. And while we were there, there was a soccer match and one of the teams was staying in the hotel and having breakfast there! The hotel staff speaks English well and were very nice and helpful. The hotel is in a safe neighborhood of Sant'Elena, which is further down the Venice island, and is one of the neighborhoods in Venice where the locals live. It was nice and quiet at night and we slept very well. We rode the vaporetto up and down the Grand Canal and the Sant'Elena stop is just a few down from San Marco - it took us just minutes to get there by vaporetto. If you wanted to walk, there's a very nice walkway along the waterfront that goes through some pretty parks and takes about 15 to 20 minutes to walk to San Marco. It was not hard at all to get to the hotel from the train station on the vaporetto. The vaporetto takes you to the Sant'Elena stop and from there it is a 2 minute walk through a park. We bought vaporetto tickets that allowed us unlimited rides while we were there, which I recommend. The only drawback is if you have to go to the airport very early in the morning, you'll have to take a water taxi which is pricey (about 90 Euros) which we had to do since we left for the airport at 420am. It did come right to the side of the hotel though. If your plane leaves at a more reasonable hour, you can take public transportation or the Alilaguna which is also affordable. Staying at this hotel really allowed us to enjoy being in the hustle and bustle of Venice and yet feel like we were easily getting away from the commotion when we wanted to. The vaporettos are plenitful and come often and were not crowded when we got on it at the Sant'Elena stop and or when we were returning to our hotel. When we return to Venice, I would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JF4175
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a quiet location, about a 20 to 30 minute walk from most of Venice's activities. Nice comfortable rooms, good bathrooms, quiet location. It's a bit far from things, but you can walk or take the water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: francois d
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel before, in 2004 and we liked it so much we returned to it. we stayed 3 nights. the hotel is in a perfect quiet location, away from the crowds and very close to the vaporetto stop and within walking distance (15 to 20 minutes) along the waterfront to san marco. it is now part of the best western chain and it has a restaurant (closed on sundays). it is a clean, comfortable hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. the area of sant elena does not have many restaurants but we can also recommand Sant Giorgio, halfway between sant elena and san marco on the waterfront. good price quality.

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfied”
Reviews.Author: PaulY55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for seven nights at the end of August 2007. Our de luxe room was more than adequate; it was quiet and on a non smoking floor as we had requested. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom large and everything was spotless. The toiletries and towels provided were fine and we had no grumbles with the servicing of our room. It made a nice change to find a European hotel with tea and coffee making facilities in the bedroom. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant. A previous reviewer commented on the possibility of noise from the nearby football ground. There were two matches when we were there and whilst you could hear noise it caused us no inconvenience as they seemed to start around 5pm. I don't know which way the supporters went to get to the ground but they were nowhere near rhe hotel. I think there are three restaurants/cafes in the area around the hotel- we visited one of them, which was ok. We had intended to walk to and from the hotel but as it was so hot we bought travel passes which gave us the freedom to use the water buses, which was great fun. If you are only staying one or two nights in Venice you may prefer to stay more centrally. This is a very pleasant hotel in a safe neighbourhood, and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neptune24
Reviews.Content: Good, clean rooms. Breakfast was very pleasing with plenty of choice. Fruit, cheeses and ham all excellent. In a good location for water bus etc. Pleasanr walk to St. Marks. Would recommed.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hailes family
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with two teenage boys, stayed four nights at this hotel at the start of August 2007. We loved it. We selected it based in part on reviews on this site and can agree with most of the positive points mentioned. It is some distance from St Mark's square - the 20-30mins mentioned in other reviews seems more realistic than the "a few minutes" on the hotel's own website - but then if you're a tourist staying in Venice you're going to be buying the vaporetto tourist ticket anyway (aren't you ?) so why not take advantage of boats every five minutes or so which take 10-12 minutes for the two or three stop trip. Some may quibble with the room decoration - if you are looking for quaint venetian charm then go elsewhere - but what you get here is nice, modern styled rooms with plenty of space and facilities that work. The pictures of the hotel on the Best Western website are representative of what we had in both rooms. Top marks for the air conditioning in our room, which was effective without being noisy and thus even a light sleeper like me could sleep with it left on - helped by the fact that the fan speed automatically reduced when the set temperature was reached. Room cleanliness on arrival was good, although we did feel that the servicing of the rooms during the days we were there was not as thorough as it could have been - cups were left dirty one morning, for example. Buffet style breakfast was good - plenty of cereals, breads, spreads, meats, fruit and fruit juice, etc. The scrambled egg and fried bacon were the only hot food and a bit of a let down, but that's consistent with other hotels in Italy. Reception were helpful in dealing with those queries we had and we found no problems with speaking English to any of the staff. One point if you are considering staying here: the hotel is right beside the football ground so your experience of staying might be different if there's a match on.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd....”
Reviews.Author: labradorstar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at this lovely hotel. It is in a very quiet, residential area of Venice, but only about 15 mins walk to the centre, or 5 mins on the vaporetto. The rooms were spacious and clean - we had a junior suite (had booked via the hotel website for a special offer and had to pre-pay in full) with enormous bed, sofa, minibar, roomsafe, bathrobes and large bathroom with twin washbasins. The hotel was clean, the staff helpful, and the breakfasts fantastic - cereals, ham, cheese, bacon, eggs, yogurt, cake, doughnuts (!), rolls, croissants, juice, coffee, etc. Breakfast could be taken in the garden if you wanted. All in all we could not fault the hotel in any way, and would definitely stay there again. The only thing I would say is there is not much in the immediate area - a couple of small local shops and one cafe were all we could find. However, this is not a problem as it is so easy to get around, and the walk to the centre takes you through the local park and along the waterfront. Re travelling to and from the airport, if you are a largeish group, or have lots of money, a private water taxi is the most amazing way to arrive - the route takes you through the main canal of Murano, so you get to see some of the sights there, and stops on a small, quiet canal, just one minute's walk from the Sant Elena. Otherwise the best way is to take the Alilaguna service to the Lido (12 euros per person) and then it's just one stop on the water bus to Sant Elena. As we expected, Venice in August was very crowded, especially when the day trippers were there, and it was lovely to escape back to some peace and quiet at this hotel. Also, if you have children with you as we did (2 teenagers), it is very handy for going to the Lido for a day on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: bjrobertson
Reviews.Content: A truly wonderful hotel. Away from the madding crowd which is Venice but near enough to visit all the major sights. A former monastery it has been renovated and provides excellent facilities. The rooms are bright with all you would expect from a four star hotel. It has an enclosed garden which is bliss to relax in with a spritzer after a days sightseeing. We booked direct with Best Western and paid 105 euros a night with a fantastic breakfast, a bargain. On the vaperetto it is ten minutes away from St Marks square and Venice Lido. From the Tronchetto a number 82 change at St Marks for a number 1 and you are there. There is a restaurant around the corner that all the locals use serving good food. You do not need to pay crazy prices.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Quiet and Clean”
Reviews.Author: gobob
Reviews.Content: It's taken me a year to write this because I didn't want to give away my secret. I spent months researching affordable, off-the-beaten path hotels for a trip my wife and I took last year from Sorrento to Trieste, with Rome and Venice in bewteen. We booked through the Best Western website. It is about 40 minutes by vaporetto from the train station, but you can easily enjoy a walk along the lagoon with fabulous views of the city and arrive in St. Mark's Sq. within 20 minutes once you've dropped your bags. Along the way, plenty of quiet lanes and local restaurants and cafes to bide your time before the rush of the tourist center. The hotel was clean, and the rooms were comfortable. The highlight must be the breakfast, which featured coffee, American breakfast and pastries and fruit. The yard seen in other pictures is quite relaxing, and the leafy square between the dock and the hotel is idyllic. All in all, it costs about a third of what you'd pay in the heart of the city, while getting a quiet place to sleep at night and a beautiful walk home after dinner. You'll never get my Rome hotel out of me, however; the best secrets are never told!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality is the name of the game.”
Reviews.Author: LucianoValentino
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by a tour company and I found it to be one of the nicest hotels in our two week journey through all of Italy. It was quiet, and far from the tourist areas which were easily accessable. The room was a decent size and the only drawback to it was the shower closet in the bathroom was quite small for a larger than average couple. But the view was good and the breakfast s (our only meals there) were excellent. It all made the stay enjoyable. The employees there made you want to come back and even provided an English language newspaper for its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: hungarianelephant
Reviews.Content: The Sant'Elena is a Best Western, but don't let that put you off. This is not a soulless chain, but a rather charming little haven. First off, it is in a quiet residential area, about a mile from San Marco. That might look remote on the map, but in fact it is a bonus, especially if you are staying for more than a day or so, as by then you will be desperate to escape the crowds. There is a vaporetto stop a minute's walk from the hotel, so you could be in San Marco in 10 minutes if you wanted to. Personally, we preferred the 20 minute stroll. We arrived around 10pm, but the hotel chef was happy to do dinner. All the staff were thoroughly professional (if rather reserved, which seems to be common enough in the Veneto), and spoke good English while being prepared to indulge bad Italian. The rooms are reasonably spacious and comfortable. My one gripe would be that the pillows appear to be made from cardboard and twist your neck into contorted positions. If staying there again I would consider taking an inflatable pillow, but it wouldn't put me off. Breakfast was far above the usual reconstituted orange and dubious crackers that you so often get on the continent. In fact, you could pleasantly waste most of the morning dining out on the terrace. All in all, I don't think I would bother looking at other hotels if staying in Venice again. Sant'Elena is pretty much perfect, and not a bad price for the city. One tip I would offer is to ignore the "official" way of getting from the airport to the hotel. The "fast" ferry, when it deigns to leave, takes over an hour to travel the couple of miles to Lido, before you get a no. 1 the single stop to Sant'Elena. And there's very little to see. It's quicker overall and cheaper to take a bus from outside the airport terminal to Piazzale Roma, and change to a vaporetto 41 / 51 / 61. We did this in reverse (where the numbers are 42 / 52 / 62) and it cut over half an hour off the journey time.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pascale24
Reviews.Content: What a great find! This hotel actually lived up to everything they claimed on the website and more! We liked the modern decor of our room as well as the breakfast room. The location looks far on the map but it is an easy, enjoyable walk from the garden area to the hustle and bustle of the center of town. We enjoyed being away from everything. The breakfast was great and everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The front desk helped us make tour reservations and were very knowledgeable. I have told everyone about the hotel since returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sant'Elena”
Reviews.Author: sixseven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sant'Elena in Venice for two days/nights. This is a lovely hotel in a beautiful residential area of Venice. It was once a monastery. Our room was very comfortable. The bed was comfortable for my wife and I [we are tall ] but was a little hard for my wife's liking. Plenty of hot water and pressure for showers. A very quiet and peaceful location away from the crowds of tourists in the main center of Venice. No noise at night being this is a residential area with no cars and the people having to get up in the mornings for work or school. The hotel is about a mile from the downtown area of Venice so you must be willing to walk a little or catch the vaporetto#1 to Piazzo San Marco. There are plenty of places to eat in the neighborhood. If you are looking for a top notch hotel to come home to after a long day of sightseeing/shopping I think this place is ideal. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsTraveller
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Sant Elana via the waterbus which was a 30 minute trip from the bus station. The walk from the bus stop to the hotel was less than 5 minutes and was easy to find. It's accessed through a small green park and there are local homes nearby. It was very quiet and peaceful and was an extremely safe area. We walked to a local pizzeria and passed few people but felt totaly safe. The reception staff were more than helpful. They recommended some local eateries and were even able to assist when the lock broke on my husbands suitcase! The breakfast was good. We had a choice of scrambled egg and bacon as well as the usual continental fair. There was lovely cake for breakfast too! We were not rushed, service was excellent and the ambience was pleasant. The hotel was very clean and the bedroom was modern. We had a large bed, satellite TV, mini bar and tea and coffee in the room. The air conditioning / heating wasn't adjustable so were too hot but we simply opened the balcony door! We had 2 basins and the shower was strong so I think it was a power-shower. I don't agree the walk to San Marco is 15 minutes as the website suggested but that wasn't a problem. The water bus ride was about 10 minutes and they are so frequent it was never an inconvenience. In fact, it was nice to go back to a quieter area - at night we opened the balcony door and heardnothing but birds in the early morning and church bells. I will certainly return to Venice and will stay at this hotel again. It's to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: benardus
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in hotel Sant Elena and had a great time. The breakfast is amazing, we think the best in whole Italy! The hotel is not in the centre of Venice, but East-Castello is a nice part of this town. We paid for a 7-days ACTV- ticket (vaporetta boats) only Euro 52 (one way-ticket is already Euro 6!). We hope to visit Venice again and shall certainly stay in hotel Sant Elena!

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel for me in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Adelady
Reviews.Content: This past October was my third visit to the Sant'Elena. The best part about this hotel *IS* how far away it is from the frenetic, smelly craziness of the centre of Venice. I adore Venice but I just cannot handle its crowdedness 24/7. The Sant'Elena offers a beautiful sanctuary that is still in the city itself, but in a residential neighborhood that allows one to see a different, less touristy side of the city than usual. You'll never battle crowds here for anything. If you're like me, you will cherish the stroll through the Parco delle Rimembranze to get back to the hotel each night, rather than finding it a hassle. It is definitely a long stroll, but don't be deceived by some reviews... whoever took 45 minutes to walk to St. Mark's Square must have been walking blindfolded. It takes me 20 minutes at a normal pace, and it's an incredibly scenic walk. Via Garibaldi, which has some of my favorite places to eat in Venice, is an easy walk, less than 10 mins. With the amazing food in Venice, the exercise walking to and from the Sant'Elena one or more times per day is a huge plus for me. This hotel deserves its stars, as the quality of the rooms is excellent and the service very good. Breakfast is better than most Italian hotels, and the terrace dining area is sublime on cool fall mornings. There is an afternoon happy hour, and one of my single favorite moments of a month-long holiday all over Europe was enjoying a cocktail with my husband on that terrace, playing a leisurely game of chess on one of the many game boards that's available for guest use. I would never stay at another hotel in Venice, this one is just too serene and lovely to pass up. The tranquility that arises from its relative isolation is absolutely its best feature.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us...”
Reviews.Author: TheJGuy
Reviews.Content: We liked the Sant'Elena! (Understatement) Definitely lived up to the photos and description on the Best Western Website. Located on the eastern edge of Venice, last stop on the Vaporetto before the Lido. Quiet area accessed through a Park. The lower energy level was welcome following a day of enjoying "downtown" Venice. The room was very comfortable and well maintained. The bathroom was spacious and well equipped. We had a small balcony overlooking the courtyard. The front desk staff was very courteous and spoke English. The Breakfast Buffet was the best I have ever experienced. A nice selection of food to suit most diets. The breakfast room itself was very spacious and well designed. Great Coffee!! A very enjoyable base for our exploration of Venice & Murano.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem away from the city”
Reviews.Author: KatKen
Reviews.Content: This was a Best Western Hotel, but was more like a Hyatt! The hotel is new, contemporary and very clean. The room was spacious with a double sink in a gorgeous marble bathroom. The Front desk staff, including Ricardo, was friendly and helpful. They answered all questions and helped us switch our car rental location to one that was closer. Oscar the bartender was great. We enjoyed sitting at the bar after a busy day in Venice and talking with him. The breakfast was the best in Italy, and included BACON AND EGGS!! (highly unusual in Europe) The hotel is a good 20 min. walk to the heart of Venice, but the water taxi stop is a one minute walk from the hotel door. We found the location to be great and not a drawback because we enjoyed the water taxi ride to St. Mark's square. (10 minutes) The hotel is in a quiet, charming and safe neighborhood, and gives the tourist a taste of how Italians live with their families. There is quaint little restaurant around the corner from the hotel, and a little pizzaria that had outdoor seating and looked out at the taxi stop and water. For dinner, instead of going into Venice, you can take the water taxi to Lido, and enjoy fine restaurants and upscale shopping at reasonable prices. We would go back to Sant Elena - its a very nice hotel. See our reviews on San Gallo Palace Hotel in Florence and The Grand Hotel Ritz in Rome if you think this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: katydo
Reviews.Content: We got what I consider a good rate for a hotel in expensive Venice - â‚¬448 for 3 nights including breakfast. The hotel were helpful in providing directions from the Ryanair bus stop and the 51 vaparetto brought us there with only 5 stops, depositing us no more than 200 m from the hotel door. Be aware that in Venice, you will spend a lot of your time wandering clueless to your whereabouts so the hotel's location was very easy to find which was a godsend. It is in a quiet leafy neighbourhood which my husband and I enjoyed returning to after the relentless crowds of Venice, but is still only 10 minutes (I timed it!) from St. Mark's Sq. by the waterbus. We bought the â‚¬25 3 day vaparetto pass which is great value and a great way to cruise the city cheaply. Our room was on the ground floor looking out on a small enclosed garden which was very pretty, although the room was on the small side. It was clean, modern and well-equipped and nice to be able to sit outside and read or just relax. There was no resteraunt in the hotel and I would not recommend the ones recommended by the hotel in nearby Via Garibaldi - expensive and lacking in atmosphere. It is much better to hop on the vaporetti and head into the city - but beware the overpriced tourist traps near the centre, Walk a little and you'll do better. â‚¬13 for a coke? Believe it! Overall we were very happy with the hotel, and compared to some of the places we priced in the city, glad we made the choice we did.

Reviews.Title: “If returning to Venice we would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mike21212
Reviews.Content: Clean, helpful staff and it is in a great location, away from all the crowds. The rooms are larger than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and setting”
Reviews.Author: Barney38
Reviews.Content: Our double room was spacious, clean and modern, with all of the facilities that we expected. We enjoyed the 20 minute walk into central Venice and found it very relaxing. The water bus is so easy to use and convenient it offers a good alternative to walking, should this be a problem. The hotel is right next to a park, which makes it a tranquil place to stay. We would certainly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: sallyglebe
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very convenient for the no 1 water bus. Very quiet location. Well furnished rooms although ours was rather small. Lovely garden with loungers and good breakfast on the terrace. Very good base to explore Venice and the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern - ideal base for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Beetlemeg
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights during August 2006. Booked room for 2 adults and 1 teenager which was very spacious, clean and modern. Lovely big doors/windows with balcony, overlooking gardens and surrounded by old residences which are very pretty. Hotel is extremely peaceful and gives a real feeling of tranquility. Good location as walk to Venice is interesting and only takes about 20 minutes with views of the city all the way. Also only one stop by varporetta to Lido which is worth a visit. Breakfast was good and tasty - proper toast!! Overall, a really great hotel - ideal if you like modern and clean lines. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, modern and cool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break staying with a friend at the Hotel Sant Elena in Venice. The hotel is, as has been said in other reviews, a converted convent situated a 15 to 20 minute walk from St Mark's. We really enjoyed our stay and found the hotel a peaceful haven after the bustling centre of Venice. Our air-conditioned room was spacious with a lovely bathroom and spotlessly clean. The staff were polite and helpful. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant so only a buffet breakfast is available but there are so many wonderful places to eat either within the vicinity (including some reasonably priced restaurants on Via Garibaldi) or more centrally. There was a good choice at breakfast, cereals, fruit, breads, eggs, bacon, cheese, meats and it was nice to sit outside to eat in the lovely garden area - a real haven. Although out of the centre, the hotel is very easily accessible by vaporetto - we flew into Treviso, so after the bus journey to Piazzalle Roma we hopped onto the number 42 (about a 30 minute ride); we could also have taken the No 1 (which we did later in our stay) -well worth a journey as it goes along the length of the Grand Canal and takes about an hour, or the 52 (again about 30 minutes). I would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel and would return - given the chance!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy gem of a hotel in a beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: luluh
Reviews.Content: Booked for this hotel with Superbreak for a week, so pre paid in England which was easy. We took a Water Taxi from Marco Polo to Sant Elena and hotel was over a bridge, 1 min walk through shady park straight up Calle Buccari to Hotel Sant Elena. Modern, sophisticated hotel reminded us of Malmaison chain on a pretty unspoilt area of Venice, where the locals come to sit in the shade of the park. Lovely large Junior Suite, TV with sky, mini bar, safe in the wardrobe (free!) not enough coat hangers for a week so bring a few of your own. Tea/coffee facilities (never enough milk). Lovely breakfast area and outside courtyard to eat breakfast too! serve yourself, cereal, yoghurts, fruit, croissant, cheese/ham and hot too, eggs, bacon and lots of juices. The stroll down to St Marks is pretty along the front past the Biennale park, over a bridge so you can see The Arsenale in the distance but in reality it takes about 45 minutes, quite fun trying the get there via back streets, get a good map and loose yourself in local culture! The Vaporetto stop is called Sant Elena and the number 1 or 42 takes you down to St Marks very quickly. Lovely, clean, bright airy hotel, staff pleasant. used by many tour companies. Hidden Gem. Can;t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed at the Sant Elena in May 2006. We had booked the hotel via their own website and got a reasonable (for venice) deal of 166 euro per night (incl breakfast). The hotel was in excellent order & immaculate. The staff helpful and polite. All in all we were really impressed. The only downside being that the hotel is located a good 15 minutes walk away from San Marco (far too long a walk with suitcases when the waterbuses are on strike as we found out!) We would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit venice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: debSheffieldUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days. Location excellent. Rooms above average. Staff very freindly. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last stop of a long Italy vacation, and Sant Elena was an absolutely perfect choice. A spotless, sleek, modern hotel in a beautifully quiet residential neighborhood. Moderately priced (for Venice), a friendly staff, and a lovely garden out back to eat breakfast or have a drink. Close to the vapareto, or a fifteen-minute life-affirming stroll to the center of town. Highly recommended. Unless we become millionares and trade up to the Cipriani, this is where we would return, without question.

Reviews.Title: “not as goodas expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went in a party of 2couples on an easter break, booking following good reviews on this web site. The location is someway from St Marks and this has pros and cons - the main pro being that it is quiet. The water bus service is excellent however and cheap if you buy the 3day pass, otherwise 5euros/trip. Rooms to us were average for 4star, small on storage. Breakfast was reasonable. In room coffee/milk supply was tight (1 sachet/day/room!) The bar shuts early and they will not serve residents when they have deemed it shut (we were turned away at 11pm and 11.55pm on 2days even tho staff were in the bar - we would have expected a normal 4 star service to serve us). I do not know how this compares with other Venice hotels, but suspect it might be the norm?. Staff were efficient and professional rather than helpful or friendly. We had not realised that it was a Best Western hotel, which might have swayed our decision towards staying more in the centre in another Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: PECurt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, 200 metres from the Sant Elena waterbus stop, or a 15-20 minute walk from St Mark's Square. It is smart, newly decorated and clean, with a helpful staff. The breakfast buffet is excellent, with hot and cold choices. My double room was large, quiet and stylishly decorated - the bathroom was also large and spotless. Although there is no restaurant, the area has a number of restaurants. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week-end”
Reviews.Author: joyceb2204
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful week-end at the Sant' Helena. The hotel is situated far from the madding crowds of central Venice in a residential area where "real people" live and go about their daily business but has easy access to the city centre via the vaporetto no.1 route which goes all the way up the Grand Canal. The stop is 2 minutes from the hotel. The hotel is spotlessly clean and freshly decorated with a minimalist,Japanese theme in black and silver.We had a standard bedroom of adequate size and a view of the courtyard garden, a canal and the bay of San Marco. The buffet breakfast is served in a bright, airy dining-room and has a good choice of food, including a hot option.The staff are welcoming and helpful. Best of all is the service at reception where the staff went out of their way to give advice and were so pleasant. Like a previous reviewer, we feel that it would have been perfect if we could have eaten a light meal in the restaurant in the evening before going back into the city. Finally, a bit of advice about the Alilaguna ferry service from Marco Polo airport. Contrary to the literature, the courtesy bus to the boat stop was not operating and the albeit short walk carrying luggage could be a problem for elderly or infirm passengers.Also, you don't have to travel on the ferry to San Marco to get the vaporetto to Sant' Elena. You can get off at Lido and transfer to vaporetto there. Sant' Elena is the next stop.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier Hotel Sant' Elena
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Buccari 10, 30132 Venice, Italy
